coveo:metadata.description: Manoj Murumkar, Senior Manager, Data Engineering at CBS Interactive and Bala Venkatrao, Director of Products at Cloudera provide insight into how CBSi uses Cloudera Manager to effectively manage the complete lifecycle of CBSis Hadoop operations. They will highlight the Cloudera Manager features that have been most helpful to CBSi and share best practices on how to use the tool. This webinar will conclude with a preview of the future roadmap for Cloudera Manager.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar | How CBS Interactive uses Cloudera Manager to effectively manage their Hadoop cluster

coveo:metadata.description: 451 Analyst Matt Aslett, Cloudera CEO Mike Olson and Cloudera customers RIM and YP (formerly AT&T Interactive) to learn: Why Cloudera customers have chosen CDH to get started with Hadoop The business value resulting from analyzing new data sources in new ways How Hadoop will change these Customers business and industry over the next 3-5 years.
coveo:metadata.title: The Business Advantage of Hadoop: Lessons from the Field - Cloudera Summer Webinar Series: 451 Research

coveo:metadata.description: The way organizations put data to work is rapidly changing. Apache Hadoop and its related projects are maturing as an integrated stack to store, process and analyze huge volumes of varied semi-structured, unstructured and raw data quickly becoming the standard infrastructure layer for big data workloads. With the advent of Hadoop, businesses can now affordably analyze massive amounts of data and open up a whole new world of possibilities to add value to the business. You will also learn how to understand key challenges when deploying a Hadoop cluster in production, manage the entire Hadoop lifecycle using a single management console, deliver integrated management of the entire cluster to maximize IT and business agility.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar | Modernizing Your IT Infrastructure with Hadoop - Gartner

coveo:metadata.description: Apache Hadoop, an open-source platform, is increasingly gaining adoption within organizations trying to draw insight from all the big data being generated. Hadoop, and a handful of open-source tools that complement it, are promising to make gigantic and diverse datasets easily and economically available for quick analysis. A burgeoning partner ecosystem is also essential to helping organizations turn big data into business value. This webinar will speak to businesses expectations of big data, benefits of analytic platforms built on Hadoop, business challenges that led to evaluation of big data technologies, and the framework for success. Learn from Cloudera customer Relay Health in the Healthcare and Life Sciences industry as they share their medical Hadoop use case.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar | Realizing the Promise of Big Data with Hadoop Forrester

coveo:metadata.description: Why does big data matter? Are you trying to pinpoint effective strategies to increase revenue and/or customer loyalty? In this webinar understand the business and technical challenges of big data solutions, how to leverage big data for competitive advantage, the must haves of an effective big data solution, and real-world examples of Cloudera, Pentaho, and Dell big data solutions in action.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar | Using Hadoop Analytics to Gain a Big Data Advantage

coveo:metadata.description: Learn about the opportunity for big data in the mainstream enterprise, the role of Hadoop in processing big data, and the integration of big data and Hadoop into established enterprise workflows.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar | What the Hadoop? - GigaOM Pro

coveo:metadata.description: Learn what measurable improvements government agencies are reporting from using big data, the top government big data use cases, what successful government big data programs have in common, and understand what new or unsolved requirements remain.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar | Parsing the Union: the Federal Government and Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: Learn how Cloudera Impala empowers you to: Perform interactive, real-time analysis directly on source data stored in Hadoop,interact with data in HDFS and HBase at the speed of thought, and reduce data movement between systems & eliminate double storage.
coveo:metadata.title: Impala: Real-time Queries in Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Traditional data management and business intelligence is struggling under the pressures of increasing data volumes, new diverse data types, and a growing number of business users who need to make better data-driven decisions. Hadoop provides an affordable and scalable platform for storing, processing, and analyzing "big data", but it's just the beginning. Watch Datameer and Cloudera share what it takes to deliver successful analytic applications in the new world of big data. This webinar will address the following questions: What is Hadoop? What problems does it solve? How do leading organizations get the most out of Hadoop? How can you get started using Hadoop?
coveo:metadata.title: Delivering Insightful Analytics in a Data Driven World

coveo:metadata.description: This is a technical deep dive about Cloudera Impala, the project that makes scalable parallel databse technology available to the Hadoop community for the first time. Impala is an open-sourced code base that allows users to issue low-latency queries to data stored in HDFS and Apache HBase using familiar SQL operators. Presenter Marcel Kornacker, creator of Impala, begins with an overview of Impala from the user's perspective, followed by an overview of Impala's architecture and implementation, and will conclude with a comparison of Impala with Dremel and Apache Hive, commercial MapReduce alternatives and traditional data warehouse infrastructure.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Impala: A Modern SQL Engine for Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Hadoop is quickly becoming the standard for data management for enterprises. But Enterprise buyers have more demanding requirements for their systems beyond what the early adopters needed. This 2-part webinar series and learn about our new advancements within Cloudera Enterprise, the Platform for Big Data, with new capabilities that extend our leadership in delivering what you require. Cloudera set the industry standard with Cloudera Manager, the first end-to-end management application for Apache Hadoop. Now it is extending that lead with the release of Cloudera Manager 4.5, which delivers expanded capabilities designed to simplify the management and adoption of Hadoop. This presentation will show you how Cloudera Manager 4.5 allows you to perform rolling platform upgrades, consistently meet or exceed SLAs and RTOs through simplified management and process automation, easily correlate and visualize metrics through intuitive and interactive charts, manage heterogeneous clusters, better integrate with existing enterprise IT management tools via SNMP,and much more.
coveo:metadata.title: What the Enterprise Requires - Usability

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Enterprise BDR delivers centralized disaster recovery for data and metadata, enabling you to prepare for disaster by moving data to your secondary site automatically. Cloudera Navigator 1.0 provides data governance capabilities such as verifying access privileges and auditing access to all data stored in Hadoop, which are critical for customers that are in highly regulated industries and have stringent compliance requirements This presentation will teach you how to centrally configure and manage replication workflows for files (HDFS) and metadata (Hive); consistently meet or exceed SLAs and RTOs through simplified management and process automation; track access permissions and actual accesses to all data objects in Hive; HBase, and HDFS; Answer the questions, who has access to which data object, which data objects were accessed by a user, when was a data object accessed and by whom, what data assets were accessed using a service, and which device was used to access.
coveo:metadata.title: What the Enterprise Requires - Business Continuity and Visibility

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Enterprise BDR delivers centralized disaster recovery for data and metadata, enabling you to prepare for disaster by moving data to your secondary site automatically. Cloudera Navigator 1.0 provides data governance capabilities such as verifying access privileges and auditing access to all data stored in Hadoop, which are critical for customers that are in highly regulated industries and have stringent compliance requirements This presentation will teach you how to centrally configure and manage replication workflows for files (HDFS) and metadata (Hive); consistently meet or exceed SLAs and RTOs through simplified management and process automation; track access permissions and actual accesses to all data objects in Hive; HBase, and HDFS; Answer the questions, who has access to which data object, which data objects were accessed by a user, when was a data object accessed and by whom, what data assets were accessed using a service, and which device was used to access.
coveo:metadata.title: What the Enterprise Requires - Business Continuity and Visibility

coveo:metadata.description: Hadoop is quickly becoming the standard for data management for enterprises. But Enterprise buyers have more demanding requirements for their systems beyond what the early adopters needed. This 2-part webinar series and learn about our new advancements within Cloudera Enterprise, the Platform for Big Data, with new capabilities that extend our leadership in delivering what you require. Cloudera set the industry standard with Cloudera Manager, the first end-to-end management application for Apache Hadoop. Now it is extending that lead with the release of Cloudera Manager 4.5, which delivers expanded capabilities designed to simplify the management and adoption of Hadoop. This presentation will show you how Cloudera Manager 4.5 allows you to perform rolling platform upgrades, consistently meet or exceed SLAs and RTOs through simplified management and process automation, easily correlate and visualize metrics through intuitive and interactive charts, manage heterogeneous clusters, better integrate with existing enterprise IT management tools via SNMP,and much more.
coveo:metadata.title: What the Enterprise Requires - Usability

coveo:metadata.description: There is an interesting clash of perspectives occurring in the enterprise market between the Hadoop newcomers and the old school data warehousing providers. The latter are attempting to paint Hadoop into a corner, narrowing its usefulness to a limited set of functionality while at the other end, the Hadoop providers are expanding the functionality of Hadoop to broaden its applicability and usefulness. In the middle are enterprises who are trying to figure out how Hadoop fits into their existing environment alongside data warehouses and other legacy systems. They are typically conservative and pragmatic and are primarily interested in reducing the cost of their environment while squeezing more value out of their data. In this recorded webinar you will hear in-depth panel discussion around this topic. Related topics discussed include: Understanding Hadoops role with respect to the data warehouse Economic considerations for Hadoop Panel speakers include Paul Miller - Founder, The Cloud of Data, Richard Winter - President, WinterCorp, Amy O'Connor - Sr. Director Analytics, Nokia, and Dr. Amr Awahdallah - Founder and CTO, Cloudera.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop vs EDWs: Trends in Enterprise Adoption

coveo:metadata.description: Tony Baer, Ovum Principal Analyst, shares insights from his recent whitepaper Hadoop: Extending Your Data Warehouse. Deploying Hadoop as part of the data warehouse infrastructure can help organizations dramatically reduce costs; improve quality of service for query, analytics, and reporting; and provide flexibility for tapping more data for business intelligence. Attend this webinar you will learn how, Hadoop offers an economical platform to offload data transformation cycles from the warehouse, and can potentially simplify and reduce errors in the process, Hadoop brings flexibility to enterprise analytics, and how Hadoop is rapidly adding capabilities - like interactive SQL - that make it easy for the business to adopt, while delivering the enterprise hardening that IT organizations require.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop: Extending Your Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Impala and MicroStrategy can help you make new discoveries on your data. The Cloudera Impala project is pioneering the next generation of Hadoop capabilities: the convergence of interactive SQL queries with the capacity, scalability, and flexibility of a Hadoop cluster. In this on-demand webinar, Cloudera and MicroStrategy share how Impala works, how it is uniquely architected to provide an interactive SQL experience native to Hadoop, and how you can leverage the power of MicroStrategy 9.3.1 to easily tap into more data and make new discoveries.
coveo:metadata.title: Impala Unlocks Interactive BI on Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Learn how Cloudera Search enables you to tap into the power of search for your Big Data. Cloudera Search brings full-text, interactive search and scalable indexing to data in HDFS and Apache HBase. Powered by and adding to Apache Solr, Cloudera Search fully integrates with CDH to bring scale and reliability for next-generation open source search — Big Data search.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Search Webinar: Big Data Search, Bigger Insights

coveo:metadata.description: Cyber threat intelligence is a fast-growing trend within government, and Big Data analytics present a formidable tool to help you meet your mission needs for cyber security. Agencies and organizations must be able to operate with all data in their domains, without loss of fidelity from aggregations and normalization, while leveraging the existing data, formats and structures, metadata, security, and management frameworks powering the rest of the Hadoop system. Cloudera Impala, an open source massively parallel processing (MPP) query engine that runs natively on Apache Hadoop, stands as the tool of choice to address these challenges. Justin Erickson, Cloudera's director of product management, and Wayne Wheeles, Six3 Systems' analytic, infrastructure and enrichment developer for cyber security, teach you how you can use Cloudera Impala to: Operate with all data in your domain Address cyber security analysis and forensics needs Combat fraud, waste, and abuse Justin and Wayne also present the Impala Mission Demonstration Platform (IMDP), a demo built by Wayne to test and showcase Impala's ability to perform near-real-time network analysis for cyber security. All are invited to attend; developers, analysts, and individuals who have a strong understanding of Hadoop are strongly encouraged to register.
coveo:metadata.title: Combat Cyber Threats with Cloudera Impala & Apache Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Syncsort and Cloudera provide you a seamless approach to unlocking the value of all of your data including mainframe data. Learn about the cost savings and other benefits of ingesting and processing your mainframe data in Hadoop.
coveo:metadata.title: How to Leverage Mainframe Data with Hadoop: Bridging the Gap between Big Iron & Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: Revolution Analytics and Cloudera allow you to derive new business insights from Big Data by providing a joint solution to store, process, and analyze all your data at scale.
coveo:metadata.title: R+Hadoop: Ask Bigger (and New) Questions, Get Better, Faster Answers

coveo:metadata.description: Key highlights from Strata + Hadoop World 2013 including trends in Big Data adoption, the enterprise data hub, and how the enterprise data hub is used in practice.
coveo:metadata.title: Enterprise Data Hub: The Next Big Thing in Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: At their core, YARN and MapReduce 2s improvements separate cluster resource management capabilities from MapReduce-specific logic. YARN enables Hadoop to share resources dynamically between multiple parallel processing frameworks such as Cloudera Impala, allows more sensible and finer-grained resource configuration for better cluster utilization, and scales Hadoop to accommodate more and larger jobs.
coveo:metadata.title: Introduction to YARN and MapReduce 2

coveo:metadata.description: For organizations that need to be information driven while managing risk and cost, Apache Hadoop has emerged as the leading platform for Big Data management and analytics due to its flexibility, scalability, and economics. Yet the model of early adopters - implementing Hadoop as a special side project with dedicated expert teams - is not sustainable. In 2014, IT must look beyond the hype towards solving real business problems and make Big Data and Hadoop first-class citizens in the enterprise.
coveo:metadata.title: From Hadoop to the Enterprise Data Hub: A New Foundation for Modern Information Architecture

coveo:metadata.description: Big data has admittedly been a buzzword of-late. Somewhere behind that buzzword there's substance and actual real-world problems being solved. The Hadoop ecosystem is right at the center of this and has been rapidly maturing into a mainstream technology. Along with the technology maturing at a fast pace, the usage of the technology has also been evolving at an equally fast pace. In this talk, we'll look at how enterprises have been using the Hadoop ecosystem and how the usage has evolved over time.
coveo:metadata.title: Evolution of Hadoop in Enterprises

coveo:metadata.description: Hadoop without security can be a recipe for disaster. In this video, we'll cover six security problems with Apache Hive and how to deploy enterprise-grade security for Hadoop to address them. We discuss the security problems with Hive in detail and then how to secure Hive with Apache Sentry. Additional topics will include Hadoop security and Role Based Access Control (RBAC).
coveo:metadata.title: 6 ways to exploit Hive and what to do about it

coveo:metadata.description: Learn more about advanced analytics through the lens of a data practitioner, and how you can leverage an enterprise data hub to use ALL of your data, do more with your data, and deliver insights sooner.
coveo:metadata.title: Rethink Analytics with an Enterprise Data Hub

coveo:metadata.description: Demand for quicker access to multiple integrated sources of data continues to rise. Immediate access to data stored in a variety of systems - such as mainframes, data warehouses, and data marts - to mine visually for business intelligence is the competitive differentiation enterprises need to win in todays economy.
coveo:metadata.title: Syncsort, Tableau, & Cloudera present: Break the Barriers to Big Data Insight

coveo:metadata.description: Having collected Big Data, organizations are now keen on data science and "Big Learning." Much of the focus has been on data science as exploratory analytics, offline, in the lab. However, building a production-ready large-scale operational analytics system remains a difficult and ad-hoc endeavor, especially when real-time answers are required. Design patterns for effective implementations are emerging, which take advantage of relaxed assumptions, adopt a new tiered "lambda" architecture, and pick the right scale-friendly algorithms to succeed. Drawing on experience from customer problems, this session presents a reference architecture and algorithm design choices for a successful implementation.
coveo:metadata.title: Design Patterns for Large-Scale Real-Time Learning

coveo:metadata.description: Impala raises the bar for SQL query performance on Apache Hadoop. With Impala, you can query Hadoop data including SELECT, JOIN, and aggregate functions in real time to do BI-style analysis. As a result, Impala makes a Hadoop-based enterprise data hub function like an enterprise data warehouse for native Big Data. In this webinar featuring Impala architect Marcel Kornacker, you will explore: How Impala's architecture supports query speed over Hadoop data that not only convincingly exceeds that of Hive, but also that of a proprietary analytic DBMS over its own native columnar format. The current state of, and roadmap for, Impala's analytic SQL functionality. An example configuration and benchmark suite that demonstrate how Impala offers a high level of performance, functionality, and ability to handle a multi-user workload, while retaining Hadoops traditional strengths of flexibility and ease of scaling. You will also learn how enterprise conformed dimensions can be used as the basis for integrating Hadoop and conventional data warehouses.
coveo:metadata.title: Building a Hadoop Data Warehouse with Impala

coveo:metadata.description: Data governance is a charged topic for businesses of all sizes. For business users it is often seen as an excuse to say no, and for IT a fundamental part of protecting the organizations data assets. With the evolution of Hadoop from a cold store play to a robust enterprise data hub with a discovery layer, governance of all your data remains one to the biggest challenges to success. The discovery layer can be used as a way to bridge the gap between business and IT professionals, while still supporting the requirements around governance of data in your enterprise data hub.
coveo:metadata.title: Govern This! Data Discovery and the application of data governance with new stack technologies

coveo:metadata.description: The combination of SAS analytics and Clouderas enterprise data hub (EDH) is a common recipe for Analytics at Scale. While Clouderas EDH makes it not only feasible but economically viable to store and manage extreme volumes of data in one place, SAS In-Memory Analytics gives you the power to analyze and mine data at Scale all on a single system. With SAS In-Memory Statistics for Hadoop and supporting products, business users can use their existing SAS skills to analyze and mine vast volumes of data on the EDH.
coveo:metadata.title: SAS and Cloudera Analytics at Scale and Speed

coveo:metadata.description: The combination of SAS analytics and Clouderas enterprise data hub (EDH) is a common recipe for Analytics at Scale. While Clouderas EDH makes it not only feasible but economically viable to store and manage extreme volumes of data in one place, SAS In-Memory Analytics gives you the power to analyze and mine data at Scale all on a single system. With SAS In-Memory Statistics for Hadoop and supporting products, business users can use their existing SAS skills to analyze and mine vast volumes of data on the EDH.
coveo:metadata.title: SAS and Cloudera Analytics at Scale and Speed

coveo:metadata.description: Apache Spark is easy to develop with and fast to run. Understand how to use K-means for clustering data, where you can then find anomalies from the typical patterns for fraud detection, network intrusions, and such. Learn how Spark takes advantage of Resilient Distributed Datasets (RDD) parallel transformations on data in stable storage.
coveo:metadata.title: Large Scale Machine Learning with Apache Spark

coveo:metadata.description: The enormous legacy of EDW experience and best practices can be adapted to the unique capabilities of the Hadoop environment. In this webinar, in a point-counterpoint format, Dr. Kimball will describe standard data warehouse best practices including the identification of dimensions and facts, managing primary keys, and handling slowly changing dimensions (SCDs) and conformed dimensions. Eli Collins, Chief Technologist at Cloudera, will describe how each of these practices actually can be implemented in Hadoop.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop and the Data Warehouse: EDW 101 for Hadoop Professionals

coveo:metadata.description: The data center has gone through several inflection points in the past decades: adoption of Linux, migration from physical infrastructure to virtualization and Cloud, and now large-scale data analytics with Big Data and Hadoop. Learn how Cloudera and Intel are jointly innovating through open source software to enable Hadoop to run best on IA (Intel Architecture) and to foster the evolution of a vibrant Big Data ecosystem.
coveo:metadata.title: Intel and Cloudera: Accelerating Enterprise Big Data Success

coveo:metadata.description: To be agile in todays distributed, dynamic, and disrupted banking environment requires full situational awareness of risk. Many financial organizations manage islands of data and fail to see the interconnections of risk across these data sources. What might seem trivial by itself actually acts as part of an interconnected web of risk that in aggregate can be very significant and troubling. Learn how financial institutions are now leveraging cognitive computing and unstructured data (Big Data) to help them achieve a comprehensive and cohesive situational awareness strategy, while significantly reducing their operational costs and their reputational and regulatory risks.
coveo:metadata.title: Cognitive Computing, Technology & Infrastructure Driving Situational Awareness throughout the Financial Institution

coveo:metadata.description: Data security is no longer a checkbox in the IT or operations departments but a top business priority for most enterprises. As compliance pressures mount, the requirements and restrictions on data and data access come under increased scrutiny. Security in Hadoop is no exception.
coveo:metadata.title: Comprehensive Security for the Enterprise I: Compliance Ready Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Watch this webinar to learn what machine learning is, why you should use machine learning algorithms, what the common challenges of machine learning are, and how Clouderas enterprise data hub supports machine learning.
coveo:metadata.title: Machine Learning Loves Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Data security is no longer a checkbox in the IT or operations departments but a top business priority for most enterprises. As compliance pressures mount, the requirements and restrictions on data and data access come under increased scrutiny. Security in Hadoop is no exception.
coveo:metadata.title: Comprehensive Hadoop Security for the Enterprise | Part 1 | Compliance Ready Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: As discussed in the webinar, Compliance-Ready Hadoop on June 19th, there are four pillars of security that must be achieved to offer comprehensive security. Cloudera offers all four: perimeter, access, data, and visibility. In this webinar, we will focus on the pillars of perimeter and access. One of the benefits of Hadoop is that it easily allows for multiple entry points both for data flow and user access. We will discuss how Cloudera allows you to preserve the agility of having multiple entry points while also providing strong, easy to manage authentication. Additionally, we will discuss how Cloudera provides unified authorization to easily control access for multiple data processing engines. This is a technical webinar discussing features including Kerberos and Apache Sentry.
coveo:metadata.title: Comprehensive Security for the Enterprise II: Guarding the Perimeter and Controlling Access

coveo:metadata.description: As discussed in the webinar, Compliance-Ready Hadoop, there are four pillars of security that must be achieved to offer comprehensive security. Cloudera offers all four: perimeter, access, data, and visibility. In this webinar, we will focus on the pillar of data. With Clouderas recent acquisition of Gazzang, Cloudera is able to protect your data through encryption and powerful key management - all integrated into Cloudera Navigator. This webinar discusses how you can use Navigator capabilities such as Encrypt and Key Trustee to secure data and enable compliance. Additionally, we will discuss our joint work with Intel on Project Rhino (an initiative to improve data security in Hadoop). We also hear from a security architect at a financial services company that is using encryption and key management to meet financial regulatory requirements. This is a technical webinar discussing features including Encrypt, Key Trustee, Process-Based Access Controls, and Rhino Encryption.
coveo:metadata.title: Comprehensive Security for the Enterprise III: Protecting Data at Rest and In Motion

coveo:metadata.description: edo Interactive is using big data to transform shopping and saving with data-driven card-linked offers that are simple and targeted. Learn how edo turned to Cloudera and Pentaho to break through the constraints of traditional database systems to multiply business results while dramatically reducing costs.
coveo:metadata.title: Big Data Retail Therapy: How big data tempts customers to buy more

coveo:metadata.description: As the Hadoop ecosystem evolves, its potential value to organizations increases, and not just for the management of so-called Big Data. In fact, the vector of innovation for Hadoop 2.0 will likely trend toward the increasingly heterogeneous and mission-critical world of enterprise data. The ultimate vision will blend these two worlds in an enterprise data hub, essentially bridging the deterministic domain of business decision-making with the exploratory potential of Machine Learning and Big Data Analytics.
coveo:metadata.title: The Bloor Group: Tech Lab Series - Locked and Loaded

coveo:metadata.description: To provide visibility and transparency into your data and usage, Cloudera Enterprise has Navigator, the only native end-to-end governance solution for Apache Hadoop. In this webinar we discuss why Navigator is a key part of comprehensive security and discuss its key features including: auditing, access control, data discovery and exploration, lineage, and lifecycle management. Live demo also included.
coveo:metadata.title: Comprehensive Security for the Enterprise IV: Visibility Through a Single End-to-End Governance Solution

coveo:metadata.description: Learn how Dr. Malafsky navigates data aggregation and normalization for the Federal Procurement Data System. He'll be joined by Host Eric Kavanagh and two other Hadoop experts who will challenge his theories and processes. The episode will demonstrate in detail how data should be loaded into a Hadoop cluster, and how it can be leveraged in a number of ways to produce certifiably accurate information for serious decision-making.
coveo:metadata.title: The Bloor Group: Tech Lab Series - Back to Normal

coveo:metadata.description: During the webinar you will learn: How Opowers Hadoop architecture supports personalized insight creation and data experimentation. The evolution of Opowers hadoop architecture and some of the challenges encountered when operationalizing the platform. The critical role of Clouderas enterprise data hub and engineering expertise for building and productionalizing insights.
coveo:metadata.title: Empowering Customers with Personalized Insights

coveo:metadata.description: Denny Lee, Senior Director of Data Sciences Engineering at Concur Technologies, joins Jai in this webinar to discuss how Concur is using Spark and Clouderas enterprise data hub for real-time business insights and improved customer engagement.
coveo:metadata.title: The Future of Hadoop: A deeper look at Apache Spark

coveo:metadata.description: To ingest, store, process and leverage big data for maximum business impact requires integrating systems, processing frameworks, and analytic deployment options. Learn how Clouderas enterprise data hub framework, MongoDB, and Teradata Data Warehouse working in concert can enable companies to explore data in new ways and solve problems that not long ago might have seemed impossible. Gone are the days of NoSQL and SQL competing for center stage. Visionary companies are driving data subsystems to operate in harmony. So whats changed?
coveo:metadata.title: Better Together: The New Data Management Orchestra

coveo:metadata.description: Making decisions based on partial data sets is playing a dangerous game. What youre missing may come back to bite you. Yet there is an efficient and cost-effective way to store and analyze complete data sets no matter their size or complexity. In this webinar we discuss how to easily access and manipulate data in real time, score analytic models directly in Hadoop with no data movement, and significantly reduce costs associated with model deployment and maintenance.
coveo:metadata.title: SAS and Cloudera: Enriching the Analytical Lifecycle

coveo:metadata.description: Cloud environments are increasingly becoming a popular deployment option for Hadoop. Enterprises can take advantage of the added flexibility and elasticity of the cloud for both long-running clusters, temporary deployments or for spikey workloads. However, as more and more users choose cloud environments for critical Hadoop workloads, they are often forced to compromise on key aspects of their data platform. Cloudera Director enables the full fidelity of the Enterprise Data Hub in the cloud, without compromises. Announced with the recent 5.2 release, Cloudera Director is the simple, reliable way to deploy and scale Hadoop in the cloud, while maintaining an open and neutral platform with enterprise-grade capabilities.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Director: Unlock the Full Potential of Hadoop in the Cloud

coveo:metadata.description: Hadoop is a powerful tool for todays enterprise providing unified storage of all data and metadata, regardless of format or source, and multiple frameworks for robust processing and analytics. However, this flexibility and scale also presents challenges for securing and governing this data.
coveo:metadata.title: Innovation Without Compromise: The Challenges of Securing Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: The world around us is changing. Data is embedded in everything, and users from all lines of business want to leverage this data to influence decisions. The trick is to create a culture for pervasive analytics and empower the business to use data everywhere. The core enabling technology to make this happen is Apache Hadoop. By leveraging Hadoop, organizations of all sizes and across all industries are making business models more predictable, and creating significant competitive advantages using big data.
coveo:metadata.title: The Value of Pervasive Analytics

coveo:metadata.description: The modern enterprise must be agile in order to thrive. While there are many paths to such agility, they all start with corporate data. The key is to ensure that data is vetted and accurate, otherwise known as normalized. Today, the Hadoop ecosystem can provide exactly the kind of platform thats necessary to serve the wide range of enterprise applications both operational and analytical that run the business.
coveo:metadata.title: The Bloor Group: Tech Lab Series - The Agile Enterprise

coveo:metadata.description: Since its launch, Impala has seen rapid adoption with more than 1 million open source downloads, hundreds of customers, and support by some of the largest vendors. In the latest CDH 5.2 release, Cloudera announced Impala 2.0 - the most significant release of Impala since its initial launch. Impala 2.0 solidifies Impalas place as the best, fully integrated analytic database for Hadoop, featuring: Extreme Multi-User Performance Extensive SQL Compatibility Usability Optimizations Flexibility Native in Hadoop
coveo:metadata.title: Impala 2.0 - The Best Analytic Database for Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Intel, Cloudera and guest speaker Forrester Research, Inc. discuss the strategy of pervasive analytics and real life examples of how analytics have already been embedded into applications and workflows.
coveo:metadata.title: Pervasive Analytics Gets Real

coveo:metadata.description: With the release of CDH 5.3, Cloudera announced the general availability of transparent encryption for HDFS, as well as HDFS integration with Apache Sentry (the open source standard for unified authorization for Hadoop) - both signify impressive progress for Project Rhino.
coveo:metadata.title: Project Rhino: Enhancing Data Protection for Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Concur, the leading provider of spend management solutions and services, will be joining us to discuss how they implemented Cloudera for data discovery and analytics. Using an enterprise data hub, Concur was able to provide their data scientists a centralized environment that allowed for faster and smarter analytic development.
coveo:metadata.title: Concur Discovers the True Value of Data

coveo:metadata.description: Limitless Data, Rapid Discovery, Powerful Insight What if your data stores were limitless and accessible? data discovery was fast really fast? connectivity was so seamless you could almost take it for granted? And what if you could do all this with your preferred BI tool? Learn how to integrate Cloudera Enterprise with SAP Lumira via embedded connectivity from Simba Technologies.
coveo:metadata.title: How to Connect Cloudera to SAP Lumira with Simba

coveo:metadata.description: Pulling from their current and past experiences at data driven organizations like LinkedIn, eBay, and Bitly, DJ and Hilary will offer their insights into how to successfully deploy a data strategy within an organization.
coveo:metadata.title: Data Driven: Creating a Data Culture

coveo:metadata.description: With the ability to store, process, and analyze unlimited data of any type, Hadoop has the power to enable businesses to leverage data like never before. For many enterprises though, the lack of critical capabilities limited what data could be stored, which users could access it, and how integrated it could become within existing systems. Cloudera has been focused on developing these key, enterprise capabilities in both CDH 5 (Clouderas open source Hadoop platform) and Cloudera Enterprise 5. With multiple releases since the initial launch of Cloudera 5, Cloudera has become the leading platform for productionready Hadoop enabling the most customers across various industries to realize the true value of their data.
coveo:metadata.title: Changes in the Cloudera Hadoop Stack - CDH 5

coveo:metadata.description: RelayHealth, the healthcare technology solution segment of the Fortune 500 company McKesson Corporation, discusses how they used Cloudera as an Operational Data Store (ODS). This enabled them to drastically improve their data processing and storage allowing for increased efficiencies that drastically impacted their business.
coveo:metadata.title: RelayHealth Leverages More Data in Less Time

coveo:metadata.description: Deploying a Hadoop-based enterprise data hub as an operational data store for high-speed ingestion, processing and data prep is the first step on the journey toward big data analytics. With visual development environments and pre-built business rules, developers can prepare data faster and deliver more complete views of customers, products, and other business critical entities.
coveo:metadata.title: Modernize your Data Architecture for Fast Ingestion, Efficient Storage, and Scalable Processing

coveo:metadata.description: We demo the full lifecycle of developing operational analytics applications on an EDH including ingest, exploration, transformation, application deployment, and serving the results. Find out how quick and easy it is to develop and deploy powerful business applications on Hadoop.
coveo:metadata.title: Build Smart Applications Faster on Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Search brings full-text, interactive search and scalable, flexible indexing to an enterprise data hub. Powered by Apache Solr, Search delivers scale and reliability for a new generation of integrated, multi-workload queries. It is the only real-time search tool native to a Hadoop distribution. You will learn: What Cloudera Search is and how it enables data discovery and analytics How to perform indexing of data from various sources and in various formats Who is best suited to attend the course and what prior knowledge you should have The benefits Search delivers as part of an enterprise data hub
coveo:metadata.title: Introduction to Cloudera Search Training

coveo:metadata.description: Retention of the highest-value customer segments has historically been a lagging indicator. However, with more complete data and deeper understanding of the consumer, some telcos have developed predictive capabilities to identify at-risk customers and proactively prevent them from churning to a competitor.
coveo:metadata.title: How to Use Hadoop to Predict & Prevent Customer Churn

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera and Teradata discuss the best-in-class solution enabling companies to put data and analytics at the center of their strategy, achieve the highest forms of agility, while reducing the costs and complexity of their current environment.
coveo:metadata.title: Achieving Pervasive Analytics through Data & Analytic Centricity

coveo:metadata.description: As the adoption of Apache Hadoop continues to expand, it is being applied to more sensitive datasets in more compliance-oriented industries like Healthcare and Financial Services. These industries often include applications that needs to keep track of whos accessing something or what theyre doing with it. While data governance isnt a new discipline, data governance for Apache Hadoop presents a number of significant challenges due to data scale and flexibility. That doesnt make it any less critical though, especially for enterprises storing sensitive data or industries needing to adhere to stringent compliance regulations.
coveo:metadata.title: Ensuring Big Data Governance & Compliance with Cloudera Navigator and Informatica

coveo:metadata.description: Experts from Cloudera and Syncsort cover: The Modern Operational Data Store What it is and why you need it The ETL Offload Framework Identifying, offloading and optimizing your workloads Success stories featuring organizations that have reduced costs and sped development with ETL offload to Hadoop
coveo:metadata.title: ETL on Hadoop: How to free up data warehouse capacity and budget to drive bigger insights

coveo:metadata.description: We discuss how forward thinking organizations are leveraging Clouderas enterprise data hub (EDH), powered by Apache Hadoop, to store, enrich, and analyze data for faster remediation and identification of advanced persistent threats.
coveo:metadata.title: Data Powered Threat Detection

coveo:metadata.description: Discussion topics include: How to ensure your hardware is optimized for Hadoop The right operating environment: Cloud, on-prem, virtualization, or a hybrid approach Why open source and open standards are important to your data architecture How to think about the data lifecycle from integration to analytic apps Hadoop security and governance
coveo:metadata.title: Optimize your Architecture for Big Data Success

coveo:metadata.description: A Hadoop-based Enterprise Data Hub by Cloudera is quickly becoming the standard for storing and processing large amounts of data. Companies across industries are migrating to this technology, and the most sensitive data such as credit card numbers, social security numbers, etc - requires a degree of security that puts business leaders, regulators and customers at ease. Cloudera and MasterCard combined their respective experience of safeguarding sensitive transactional data with the science of securing and navigating Hadoop to produce the worlds first PCI-compliant Hadoop cluster. With that knowledge in hand, we have the best practices, processes, and technology to help guide your company in turning your most highly-sensitive data from a potential security liability into a strategic asset.
coveo:metadata.title: Guide Your Business Towards PCI Compliance

coveo:metadata.description: Tigran Khrimian, VP of Data Platforms at FINRA, presents on howHadoop and Cloud help transform FINRA Market Regulation Business.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop and Cloud help transform FINRA Market Regulation Business

coveo:metadata.description: Metadata, lineage and auditing are all critical components of any comprehensive data management solution. Especially for big data, this information is essential for many stakeholders from end users and data stewards, to corporate compliance and risk management. But this metadata, lineage and auditing doesn't exist in a vacuum. They are inherently interdependent on other systems. As big data systems like Hadoop power more and more critical, production applications, it is imperative that these systems have open integrations so both governance-related information can flow freely between systems to ensure a unified governance architecture.
coveo:metadata.title: The Road to Standardization for Data Management and Governance in Apache Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Global banks collectively paid more than $64 billion in penalties and fines in 2014, an increase of 30 percent from 2013. Human risk such as insider fraud, rogue traders, regulatory and trading non-compliance breaches are now the biggest risk factors for financial institutions. With fragmented systems creating data silos and so many potential points of entry to monitor - email, documents, trading systems, call center, video, social media, web, mobile and other devices the need for Hadoop and cognitive analytics for Big Data is greater than ever.
coveo:metadata.title: Detecting Insider Threats and Human Risk with Hadoop and Cognitive Analytics for Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: A brief history of Spark and its rise in popularity across developers and enterprises Spark's advantages over MapReduce The One Platform Initiative and the roadmap for Spark The future of data processing in Hadoop
coveo:metadata.title: Uniting Spark and Hadoop: The One Platform Initiative

coveo:metadata.keywords: Data warehouse replacement,Videos,Enterprise Data Hub (EDH),Webinars,Video,Analyst Reports,Big Data,Analytics,Data warehousing offload,Data Analyst,Data processing ETL offload,Decision Maker
coveo:metadata.description: Traditional data warehouse ETL has become too slow, too complicated, and too expensive to address the torrent of new data sources and new analytic approaches needed for decision making. The new ETL environment is already looking drastically different.
coveo:metadata.title: The Future of Data Warehousing: ETL Will Never be the Same

coveo:metadata.description: This expert roundtable discussion covers how big data and analytics are transforming marketing departments across every industry. As buying behaviors change with the growth of digital, social, and mobile, marketers are faced with the difficult task of collecting and analyzing every customer interaction across every channel to exceed buyer expectations.
coveo:metadata.title: Big Data in Marketing

coveo:metadata.description: Hadoop's popularity has spiked as leaders demonstrate its value for lowering the cost and increasing the flexibility for data management and analytics. But the path to success for enterprise adoption is littered with obstacles. Take on too much initially and you can find yourself struggling to make a meaningful impact.
coveo:metadata.title: Ask the Experts: How to Bring Hadoop in to the Enterprise

coveo:metadata.description: Many Hadoop deployments start small solving a single business problem and then begin to grow as organization finds more value in their data. Moving a Hadoop deployment from the proof of concept phase into a full production system presents certain challenges. IT operations teams need to manage the growing Hadoop deployment and maintain internal SLAs with their customers. In this webinar video recording Eric Sammer will present how some of the largest Hadoop clusters in the world were successfully productionized and best practices for running Hadoop.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar | Productionizing Hadoop - New Lessons Learned

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera provides accredited colleges, universities, and trade schools with the resources to streamline and accelerate adoption of Apache Hadoop, starting in the classroom. CAP not only helps education institutions prepare and certify their students for the demands of a changing market, but also equips their research departments with the software and support to leverage Hadoop in development. In conjunction with Cloudera's industry-leading CDH platform, the Cloudera University License provides CAP participants with the software needed to achieve major breakthroughs using Big Data.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Academic Partnership: Teaching Hadoop to the Next Generation of Data Professionals

coveo:metadata.description: Much of todays new data sources are unstructured, making the structured data warehouse an unsuitable platform for analyses. As a result, organizations now look at Hadoop as a data platform to complement existing BI data warehouses. Join Datameer and Cloudera in this webinar to discuss how Hadoop and big data analytics can help to: Get all the data your business needs quickly into one environment Shorten the time to insight from months to days Extend the life of your existing data warehouse investments Enable your business analysts to ask and answer bigger questions
coveo:metadata.title: How Big Data Analytics Complement Your Existing Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: If you missed Strata + Hadoop World, you missed quite a bit. This year's event was packed with Big Data practitioners across industries who shared their experiences and how they are driving new innovations like never before. Just because you weren't there, doesn't mean you missed out. In this session, we'll touch on a few of the key highlights from the show, including: Key trends in Big Data adoption The enterprise data hub How the enterprise data hub is used in practice
coveo:metadata.title: Enterprise Data Hub: The Next Big Thing in Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: For organizations that need to be information driven while managing risk and cost, Apache Hadoop has emerged as the leading platform for Big Data management and analytics due to its flexibility, scalability, and economics. Yet the model of early adopters - implementing Hadoop as a special side project with dedicated expert teams - is not sustainable. In 2014, IT must look beyond the hype towards solving real business problems and make Big Data and Hadoop first-class citizens in the enterprise.
coveo:metadata.title: From Hadoop to the Enterprise Data Hub: A New Foundation for Modern Information Architecture

coveo:metadata.description: Dr. Ralph Kimball describes how Apache Hadoop complements and integrates effectively with the existing enterprise data warehouse. The Hadoop environment's revolutionary architectural advantages open the door to more data and more kinds of data than are possible to analyze with conventional RDBMSs, and additionally offer a whole series of new forms of integrated analysis. Dr. Kimball explains how Hadoop can be both: A destination data warehouse, and also An efficient staging and ETL source for an existing data warehouse You will also learn how enterprise conformed dimensions can be used as the basis for integrating Hadoop and conventional data warehouses.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop and the Data Warehouse: Hadoop 101 for EDW Professionals

coveo:metadata.description: In this video, Bob Gourley -- respected blogger and editor-in-chief of CTOvision -- discusses the emerging need for big data technologies in the public sector and describes relevant use cases for big data in government. He also explains key requirements that are needed by public sector organizations in order to adopt these technologies, and how those organizations are addressing their unique requirements with technology provided by Cloudera.
coveo:metadata.title: Big Data in the Public Sector

coveo:metadata.description: With more users interested in these real-time workloads, Cloudera has added Kafka as an integrated part of Clouderas platform. Now this emerging open standard can be used to build complete end-to-end workflows together with other integrated components such as Apache Spark Streaming and Apache HBase. During this webinar, Anand Iyer, Product Manager at Cloudera, will provide: An in-depth overview of Kafka Details around the effort to integrate Kafka into Clouderas platform Common use cases for Kafka and how its used in conjunction with other tools A look at whats next for Kafka
coveo:metadata.title: Bringing Real-Time Data to Hadoop with Apache Kafka

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Navigator is part of Cloudera Enterprises comprehensive data security and governance offering and is a key part to meeting compliance and regulatory requirements. Through a single user interface, it provides visibility for administrators, data managers, data scientists, and analysts to secure, govern, and explore the large amounts of diverse data that land in Hadoop.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Navigator Demo

coveo:metadata.keywords: Technology,Videos,Enterprise Data Hub (EDH),Webinars,Video,Big Data,Analytics,Cloud,Customer Insights,Information Technology,Operations
coveo:metadata.description: Join Alex Gutow as she discusses real-time analytics and data in motion, self-service access for SQL analysts and data scientists alike, and public cloud and hybrid infrastructure.
coveo:metadata.title: Turning Data into Business Value with a Modern Data Platform

coveo:metadata.description: Harnessing the value of data in real-time is an increasingly common use case for Hadoop. However, advancements were necessary to fill important gaps in the storage layer. When building applications, users often had to choose: Extremely fast analytic scan rate with no ability to handle real-time modifications (HDFS with Apache Parquet) or very fast random access at the cost of scan performance (Apache HBase). For real-time analytic applications that required fast analytic performance over updating data, we started to see complex hybrid architectures emerge.
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Kudu: New Hadoop Storage for Fast Analytics on Fast Data

coveo:metadata.description: As your business scales, the amount of data you need to cultivate to drive strategic business value increases. As systems mature to handle massive amounts of user and external data it becomes possible to serve a wide variety of services and applications from a single data hub structure. Cloudera is no stranger to this concept and has built an internal data hub to better understand all aspects of their business, operations, and customers and even offer proactive support to their users. Hear from internal data platform lead Alan Jackoway about how his team built the Support Data Hub to serve as a single platform for user insights and critical company information. Learn how your team can bring in new data sources and accelerate delivery of valuable new capabilities to your business.
coveo:metadata.title: Capturing New Data Sources to Deliver Smarter Products and Services

coveo:metadata.description: Apache Hadoop has changed quite a bit since it was first developed 10 years ago, evolving into an entire ecosystem that supports a wide range of use cases and analytic applications. For Hadoop to fully embrace its place as the foundation for analytic applications, there is still work to be done around providing enterprise-grade data engineering, universal security controls, and simplified real-time architectures.
coveo:metadata.title: The Evolution of Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: When Impala was first introduced to the Hadoop ecosystem nearly three years ago, it opened up the power of big data in a way never before possible. With blazing performance, familiar accessibility, unprecedented concurrency, it brought native, analytic SQL to Hadoop and thus enabled interactive business intelligence for analysts across industries.
coveo:metadata.title: The Future of Data Discovery & Analytics on Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: The cloud is becoming a popular choice for organizations running advanced analytics on big data. A few reasons for this include flexible deployments, elasticity for compute and storage, and the voluminous data already in the cloud and available for analytics. But even with the noted benefits, production big data clusters in the cloud still make up a small fraction of all big data deployments. This webinar will cover five key considerations and provide advice for enterprises looking to run production-scale big data environments on AWS.
coveo:metadata.title: Five Tips for Running Cloudera on AWS

coveo:metadata.description: Data is driving Samsungs business, from digital marketing to loyalty & retention. By centralizing social, clickstream, application, and other customer data, Samsung is able to build and analyze richer customer 360 profiles that empower business users to exceed customer expectations.
coveo:metadata.title: Samsungs First 90-Days Building a Next-Generation Analytics Platform

coveo:metadata.description: If data has the power to reshape business positively, it also has the power to destroy it. Like the treatment of employees or supply chains, it is time to consider the ethics of how data is retained and how it is used across the enterprise. For all its benefits, Hadoop can, if not adopted thoughtfully, actually complicate the problem.
coveo:metadata.title: The Ethical Treatment of Data: Everyone Plays a Role

coveo:metadata.description: Hear from Lenni Kuff, software engineer at Cloudera and co-creator of RecordService, as he goes over the technical details of RecordService, the new security layer for unified access control enforcement.
coveo:metadata.title: Introduction to RecordService

coveo:metadata.description: Hadoop is complex software. As customers take on more powerful use cases, and deployments grow larger, delivering a superior support experience is about more than just reacting to tickets. Cloudera's support team learned early on to use data not only to quickly diagnose and resolve issues, but to predict and prevent them before they occur.
coveo:metadata.title: Data-Driven Customer Support

coveo:metadata.description: This webinar featuring experts from Cloudera and Tableau focuses on some of the challenges marketers face when trying to reach their intended targets with an effective message. Cloudera delivers a secure platform for unified data that helps marketing teams optimize campaign investments, create personalized experiences, and understand customer loyalty. Tableau is the fastest and easiest way to visualize your Hadoop data and start asking deeper questions about the effectiveness of your marketing campaign.
coveo:metadata.title: How Big Data Can Help Marketers Improve Customer Relationships

coveo:metadata.description: Big data in the cloud is no longer reserved for dev/test and POC environments. Today, leading organizations throughout the region are turning to Cloudera and Microsoft Azure to run production Hadoop workloads on public and hybrid clouds.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera on Microsoft Azure

coveo:metadata.description: Inefficient data workloads are all too common across enterprises - causing costly delays, breakages, hard-to-maintain complexity, and ultimately lost productivity. For a typical enterprise with multiple data warehouses, thousands of reports, and hundreds of thousands of ETL jobs being executed every day, this loss of productivity is a real problem. Add to all of this the complex handwritten SQL queries, and there can be nearly a million queries executed every month that desperately need to be optimized, especially to take advantage of the benefits of Apache Hadoop. How can enterprises dig through their workloads and inefficiencies to easily see which are the best fit for Hadoop and whats the fastest path to get there?
coveo:metadata.title: Unlock Hadoop Success with Cloudera Navigator Optimizer

coveo:metadata.description: With its popularity, development ease, and flexibility, Apache Spark has quickly emerged as an open standard in the Hadoop ecosystem and primed to become the next general processing layer for Hadoop. Cloudera recognized Sparks potential early and has led the development effort to unite Spark and Hadoop into a cohesive, enterprise-grade platform. Cloudera has helped hundreds of customers get success with Spark and, with the release of Cloudera 5.5, we are further expanding the use cases and capabilities of Spark as part of a production platform. We have also worked closely with partners and customers, such as Capital One, to further enable data science use cases with Spark.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop for the Data Scientist: Spark in Cloudera 5.5

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Enterprise, dont le cur repose sur Apache Hadoop, vous permet de grer toutes vos donnes, avec une vritable plate-forme unifie, scurise, maitrise, administre et ouverte. Vous pouvez ainsi tirer parti des meilleures technologies ouvertes du march, tout en implmentant les fonctionnalits ncessaires pour rpondre aux besoins mtiers les plus sophistiqus. Regarder ce webinaire de 30 min, qui vous permettra de dcouvrir toutes les fonctionnalits avances de la plate-forme Cloudera pour lentreprise.
coveo:metadata.title: Passer de Apache Hadoop une plate-forme dentreprise - Webinaire en Replay

coveo:metadata.description: Organizations across diverse industries are in pursuit of Customer 360, by integrating customer information across multiple channels, systems, devices and products. Having a 360-degree view of the customer enables enterprises to improve the interaction experience, drive customer loyalty and improve retention. However delivering a true Customer 360 can be very challenging. Gain perspectives from industry experts at Cloudera about how organizations can utilize an Enterprise Data Hub, powered by Apache Hadoop, to effectively stitch together a true 360-degree view of their customers in order to deliver personalized offerings, improve marketing effectiveness and drive down churn.
coveo:metadata.title: Using Big Data to Drive a True Customer 360

coveo:metadata.description: SQL has become a staple in any enterprise, opening up data to users across many different departments and use cases. Its no surprise that SQL access was quick to emerge within Hadoop technologies to make it easier to process and analyze the volumes of data being stored in Hadoop. Today, the Hadoop ecosystem is full of SQL-on-Hadoop technologies. However, while they may all have SQL in common, many of these tools are designed to address very different needs and use cases. In this webinar, we look at three SQL-on-Hadoop leaders available with the recent release of Cloudera 5.5 - Hive, Impala, and Spark - and how they are designed to complement each other to address use cases across the business.
coveo:metadata.title: Hive, Impala, and Spark, Oh My: SQL-on-Hadoop in Cloudera 5.5

coveo:metadata.description: Without the right data management strategy, investments in Internet of Things (IoT) can yield limited results. Apache Hadoop has emerged as a key architectural component that can help make sense of IoT data, enabling never before seen data products and solutions. Join us for this Cloudera webinar as we explore cross-industry trends driven by IoT, data architecture strategies for managing the sheer volume of data, and how to build comprehensive, secure solutions that will deliver immediate results. In this webinarVijay Raja, Solution Marketing Lead at Cloudera, will talk about the data explosion triggered by IoT and walks through the key segments and use cases for IoT today.Afterwards, Amy O'Connor, Big Data Evangelist at Cloudera, will introduce some of key attributes to look for in a data management platform for IoT, highlight a generic IoT reference architecture and walk thru some of the key IoT customer case studies.
coveo:metadata.title: Powering the Internet of Things with Apache Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Integrating Apache Spark, a cutting edge technology into your analytic ecosystem brings new challenges. In this webinar, speakers from Cloudera and from ThinkBig Analytics discuss the best practice in introducing Spark into your big data architecture: Guidelines for including Spark in your overall big data architecture and how to overcome common challenges for Spark adoption with data science users Spark examples and use cases captured from field engagements Strategies for measuring and proving business value from Spark engagements Three gotchas for unsuspecting Spark users and how to avoid them
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Apache Spark into Your Big Data Architecture

coveo:metadata.description: Watch to learn about trends in the retail, manufacturing, and supply chain industries, how decision makers can apply new data sources, technologies, and methodologies to improve daily operations, how has Lineage Logistics implemented cold chain analytics to optimize efficiencies, and the role that Hadoop and Cloudera play in cold chain analytics.
coveo:metadata.title: Rethinking Supply Chain Analytics

coveo:metadata.description: As technology continues to advance and the world becomes hyper connected, organizations are facing massive cybersecurity challenges. Organizations have to determine what parts of their organization they want to protect in order to meet technology and budget constraints. It is time for a change.
coveo:metadata.title: Expert Panel: Cybersecurity in the Hyper Connected World

coveo:metadata.description: Data is being generated at a feverish pace and many businesses want all of it at their disposal to solve complex strategic problems. As decision making moves to real-time, enterprises need data ready for analysis immediately.
coveo:metadata.title: Beyond ETL Series: End-to-End Streaming Architectures

coveo:metadata.description: Are you struggling to validate the added costs of a Hadoop implementation? Are you struggling to manage your growing data? The costs of implementing Hadoop may be more beneficial than you anticipate. Dell and Intel recently commissioned a study with Forrester Research to determine the Total Economic Impact of the Dell | Cloudera Apache Hadoop Solution, accelerated by Intel. The study determined customers can see a 6-month payback when implementing the Dell | Cloudera solution.
coveo:metadata.title: Increase your ROI with Hadoop in 6 Months presented by Dell, Intel, and Cloudera

coveo:metadata.description: Communication Service Providers (CSPs) lose around $38 Billion to fraud every year. Cloudera together with Argyle Data brings an innovative, next-generation, machine-learning based fraud analytics platform that enables CSPs to effectively drive down fraud, by helping them detect 350% more fraud in real-time, minimize false positives and drive down revenue leakage by discovering threats that are invisible to traditional systems. Learn more about the Cloudera - Argyle Data real-time fraud analytics platform and how Telcos can utilize Apache Hadoop to drive down fraud.
coveo:metadata.title: Using Hadoop to Drive Down Fraud for Telcos

coveo:metadata.description: GoPro is a powerful global brand, thanks to its innovative cameras and accessories that capture moments other cameras just miss: surfing in Maui, skiing in Tahoe, recording your childs first steps. And today, the company is nearly as well known for its user-generated content networks. Join us for this webinar hosted by Tableau, Trifacta, and Clouderafeaturing GoPro. Well dive into GoPros data strategy and architecture, from ingest and processing to data prep and reporting, all on AWS. This on-demand webinar will cover: - GoPro's Hadoop data architecture, including how tools like Kafka and Spark are used for ingest pipelines and processing - How GoPro developed an analysis loop integrating Cloudera, Trifacta, and Tableau to link the work of data scientists, engineers, and analysts
coveo:metadata.title: Extreme Sports & Beyond: Exploring a new frontier in data with GoPro

coveo:metadata.description: Security is often an afterthought when considering web and social sources, and you dont have to look far for an example of how bad actors are accessing and compromising streaming data. Cloudera aims to solve the evolving needs of real-time data use cases by enabling companies to be smarter and more secure when leveraging new data. Shravan (Sean) Pabba joins us to talk about how Cloudera is helping to secure incoming data streams.
coveo:metadata.title: Beyond ETL Series: Data Pipeline Security

coveo:metadata.description: Both born out of the dreams of cluster computing, the cloud allows for quick deployment, easy operation, and a reduced IT footprint. In this webinar, well explore how to use Hadoop on public cloud infrastructure to simplify data transformation and save on operating costs. We will discuss the rise of data processing and Data Engineering workloads in the cloud, and see a first-hand account of how Cloudera customer Sabre is using the cloud to accelerate their data processing needs.
coveo:metadata.title: Beyond ETL Series: Data Processing in the Cloud with Sabre

coveo:metadata.description: Todays incessant need to unlock faster, deeper, and better big data insights has driven companies like Cox Automotive to develop a really effective enterprise data strategy. The adoption of Platfora and Cloudera has enabled the company to successfully tap into this target segment and overcome the traditional limitations of its existing data warehouse and business intelligence (BI) tools. Join this webinar to learn how Kelley Blue Book (KBB), a subsidiary of Cox Automotive, has maximized the value of existing advertising resources and revealed previously hidden relationships among KBBs marketing campaigns, website engagement, onsite advertiser engagement, and revenue streams.
coveo:metadata.title: Kelley Blue Book Uses Big Data to Increase User Engagement Over 100%

coveo:metadata.description: One benefit of Apache Hadoop is the ability to power multiple workloads, across many different users and departments, all within a single, shared cluster. Hear how BT is doing this today and learn about new features in Cloudera Manager to provide better visibility for multi-tenant operations.
coveo:metadata.title: Multi-Tenant Operations with Cloudera 5.7 & BT

coveo:metadata.description: Apache Spark is becoming the successor to MapReduce for data processing in Hadoop. Apache Hive also continues to be the most widely used data warehouse/ETL engine with large scale adoption across enterprises. Therefore, its imperative to enable Spark as the underlying execution engine for Hive to seamlessly allow existing and future Hive workloads to leverage the advantages of Spark. With the recent release of Cloudera Enterprise, we have delivered on this goal by adding support for Hive-on-Spark. Data engineers and ETL developers can now transition from MR to Spark for their Hive workloads seamlessly thereby benefitting from the advantages of Spark without any disruption on their end.
coveo:metadata.title: Faster Batch Processing with Cloudera 5.7: Hive-on-Spark is ready for production

coveo:metadata.description: Across all industries, organizations are embracing the promise of Apache Hadoop to store and analyze data of all types, at larger volumes than ever before possible. But to tap into the true value of this data, organizations need to manage this data and its subsequent metadata to understand its context, see how its changing, and take actions on it. Cloudera Navigator is the only integrated data management and governance for Hadoop and is designed to do exactly this. With Cloudera 5.7, we have further expanded the capabilities in Cloudera Navigator to make it even easier to understand your data and maintain metadata consistency as it moves through Hadoop.
coveo:metadata.title: Optimized Data Management with Cloudera 5.7: Understanding data value with Cloudera Navigator

coveo:metadata.description: IoT creates a new challenge: how to build and operationalize continual data ingestion from such a wide and ever-changing array of endpoints so that the data arrives consumption-ready and can drive analysis and action within the business. In this webinar, Sean Anderson from Cloudera and Kirit Busu, Director of Product Management at StreamSets, will discuss Hadoop's ecosystem and IoT capabilities and provide advice about common patterns and best practices. Using specific examples, they will demonstrate how to build and run end-to-end IOT data flows using StreamSets and Cloudera infrastructure.
coveo:metadata.title: How to Build Continuous Ingestion for the Internet of Things

coveo:metadata.description: Talend talks about their partnership with Cloudera
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Partner Insights - Talend

coveo:metadata.description: Informatica talks about their partnership with Cloudera
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Partner Insights - Informatica

coveo:metadata.description: When a company is hacked, and sensitive user data released without authorisation, it's clear that information security has been breached. However, companies may be willingly or unknowingly leaking information in non-obvious ways and the villain is also a hero of the big data era: data science. Applying data science to released data sets may discover latent information within that wasn't intended to be made public. In this webinar, we'll look at a few high-profile examples, discuss what went wrong and show how it could have been avoided. This webinar has been presented by Sean Owen, Director Data Science - Cloudera.
coveo:metadata.title: Fuzzy Data Leaks: How data science now challenges information security, and what we can do about it

coveo:metadata.description: When a company is hacked, and sensitive user data released without authorization, it's clear that information security has been breached. However, companies may be willingly or unknowingly leaking information in non-obvious ways and the villain is also a hero of the big data era: data science. Applying data science to released data sets may discover latent information within that wasn't intended to be made public.
coveo:metadata.title: How data science now challenges information security, and what we can do about it

coveo:metadata.description: Firms have become obsessed with data. But the key to competitive advantage is not just more or bigger data or big data technology, it is finding actionable insights from all the data as well as embedding insight in processes and applications. This requires a change in your approach - modernized architecture and embedding insights and data in you business decisions It also requires a change in how your people work systematically to find, test and implement insights. In this webinar, Forrester Vice President and Principal Analyst Brian Hopkins presents results from two years of research into the ideas of modernizing architecture and embedding insights and data in your business decisions, recommending how to get the most out of data and analytics to gain competitive advantage
coveo:metadata.title: Moving from data to insights: How to effectively drive business decisions and gain competitive advantage

coveo:metadata.description: Genomics is upon us, made possible by big data and the technologies designed to support it. Doctors, who historically used clinical data, and researchers, who historically used genomic data, are now increasingly focused on analyzing the same single data set: introducing the opportunity to share bodies of knowledge, fostering collaborative innovation, and driving toward higher standards of care. However, this data is enormous volumes of genomic data are expected to reach two to four exabytes per year by 2025, yet the cost of genetic sequencing has decreased 100-fold over the past 10 years. Cloudera is helping solve the big data problem with its Apache Hadoop-based platform for large-scale data processing, discovery, and analytics; putting precision medicine within reach.
coveo:metadata.title: A Modern Data Strategy for Precision Medicine

coveo:metadata.description: Traditional rules based cybersecurity applications of the past are not able to protect organizations in the new mobile, social, and hyper-connected world they now operate within. However, the convergence of big data technology, analytic advancements, and a variety of other factors have sparked a cybersecurity renaissance that will forever change the way in which organizations protect themselves. During this webinar you will learn about: The current challenges cybersecurity professionals are facing today How big data technologies are extending the capabilities of cybersecurity applications Cloudera customers that are future proofing their cybersecurity posture with Clouderas next generation data and analytics management system
coveo:metadata.title: Preparing for the Cybersecurity Renaissance Webinar On-Demand

coveo:metadata.description: Bidtellect is the leading native advertising technology and solutions company that helps connect advertisers with content publishers. Many times, it can be difficult to place the right ads at scale across multiple technology platformsBidtellect helps simplify this process. As Bidtellect has grown, so has the volume of data they manage. In the space of programmatic marketing, data is key to making the right decisions to drive the proper ad placement. As a result of these challenges, they were spending more and more money on data warehouse and BI services that didn't scale. However, this data is enormous volumes of genomic data are expected to reach two to four exabytes per year by 2025, yet the cost of genetic sequencing has decreased 100-fold over the past 10 years. Cloudera is helping solve the big data problem with its Apache Hadoop-based platform for large-scale data processing, discovery, and analytics; putting precision medicine within reach.
coveo:metadata.title: Reducing licensing costs by 70% while optimizing real-time ad placement

coveo:metadata.description: Financial firms are under pressure to grow their business while containing risk and complying with many regulations world-wide. In addition, there is the growing demand from customers to improve their experience and offer new services over multiple channels. Data is at the core of these capabilities but there are many challenges to overcome: fragmentation, security, quality, privacy, retention, to name a few.
coveo:metadata.title: Big Data as Competitive Advantage in Financial Services

coveo:metadata.description: Learn how to pinpoint the business goals that matter most, how to assess your strengths and weaknesses to meet those goals, and how to build a thoughtful approach that ensures your initiatives succeed.
coveo:metadata.title: Modernizing Architecture for a Complete Data Strategy

coveo:metadata.description: As a #1 site in the highly transactional online offers market, Quotient (aka coupons.com) processes millions, and stores billions, of transactions daily. Immediate insight into what, when, and how those transactions take place is key to maintaining customer happiness and a competitive edge. How did Quotient innovate in the face of exploding data, while enhancing the value of existing investments in BI tools and skillsets? According to Eric Sit, Quotients Director of BI and Data Platforms, the key was starting a BI on Hadoop evolution.
coveo:metadata.title: How Quotients Big Data Leader Drove a BI on Hadoop Evolution
