coveo:metadata.description: Discover the origins of big data, discuss existing and new projects, share common use cases for those projects, and explain how you can modernize your architecture using data analytics, data operations, data engineering and data science. Big Data Fundamentals is your prerequisite to building a modern platform for machine learning and analytics optimized for the cloud. We'll close out with a live Q&A with some of our technical experts as well.
coveo:metadata.title: Big Data Fundamentals - Part 3

coveo:metadata.description: Please join CEO Tom Reilly, Machine Learning GM Hilary Mason, and Chief Product Officer Arun C. Murthy as they share our strategy and product roadmap to bring the right data analytics to data, anywhere you need to work with the industry's first enterprise data cloud.
coveo:metadata.title: From the Edge to AI

coveo:metadata.description: In this webinar, we introduce Clouderas new cloud-native machine learning platform, code-named ML-X and powered by Kubernetes, that makes it easy to quickly provision environments and scale resources for end-to-end data engineering and machine learning workflows, with secure data access and a unified experience across on-premises, public and hybrid cloud environments.
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Cloudera's New Cloud-Native Platform for Enterprise Scale Machine Learning

coveo:metadata.description: The Eckerson Group's Dave Wells and Cloudera's Eva Nahiri share the challenges of legacy data warehousing, the goals of modern data warehousing, and the design patterns and frameworks that help to accelerate modernization efforts.
coveo:metadata.title: Modernizing the Legacy Data Warehouse What, Why, and How

coveo:metadata.description:
2018 was a big year for Cloudera. We agreed a merger with Hortonworks and made some significant progress with our product and services offerings.
This webinar will explore the product developments at Cloudera with a live Q&A session with one of our senior systems engineers in Europe. We will discuss Cloudera Enterprise 6, Cloudera Data Science Workbench, Workload XM, Cloudera Altus, Cloudera Fast Forward Labs and more.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera 2018 Review - Live Q&A

coveo:metadata.description:
Workload Experience Manager (Workload XM) ofrece la visibilidad necesaria para migrar, analizar, optimizar y escalar eficientemente las cargas de trabajo que se ejecutan en un Data Warehouse moderno.
En este webinar analizaremos cules son los principales retos que se plantean en un Data Warehouse moderno que trabaja a escala, as como cules son los beneficios que aporta una visibilidad end-to-end del ciclo de vida de las cargas de trabajo. Realizaremos una demo en directo con casos reales de clientes y veremos cual el la visin de futuro de Workload XM.
coveo:metadata.title: Workload XM: Gestin inteligente de las cargas de trabajo para data el Data Warehouse moderno

coveo:metadata.keywords: Data warehouse replacement,Videos,Webinars,Data Warehouse,Cloud,Data warehousing offload,Advanced Analytics,Webinars
coveo:metadata.description: In this on-demand webinar, David Loshin of TDWI & David Dichmann of Cloudera consider evolving beyond the traditional data warehousein particular, looking at ways to leverage cloud computing and associated services to complement the traditional data warehouse with data discovery, collaborate with new classes of users, and uncover new use cases for gaining advantage from your data. We will look at the economic, performance, and competitive business benefits of the cloud as a platform for envisioning integrated advanced analytics.
coveo:metadata.title: TDWI: Expanding Analytical Horizons in the Cloud

coveo:metadata.description: Learn how organizations are deriving unique customer insights, improving product and services efficiency, and reducing business risk with a modern big data architecture powered by Cloudera on Azure. In this webinar, you see how fast and easy it is to deploy a modern data management platformin your cloud, on your terms.
coveo:metadata.title: Leveraging the Cloud for Analytics and Machine Learning

coveo:metadata.description: Join Cloudera as we outline how we use Cloudera technology to strengthen sales engagement, minimize marketing waste, and empower line of business leaders to drive successful outcomes.
coveo:metadata.title: The Cloudera Story: Shortening the Sales Cycle with a Modern Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: Clouderas Data Science Workbench (CDSW) is available for Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) clusters for secure, collaborative data science at scale. During this webinar, we provide an introductory tour of CDSW and a demonstration of a machine learning workflow using CDSW on HDP.
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Cloudera Data Science Workbench for HDP

coveo:metadata.description: Watch this webinar to understand how Hortonworks DataFlow (HDF) has evolved into the new Cloudera DataFlow (CDF). Learn about key capabilities that CDF delivers such as - Powerful data ingestion powered by Apache NiFi. Edge data collection by Apache MiNiFi. IoT-scale streaming data processing with Apache Kafka. Enterprise services to offer unified security and governance from edge-to-enterprise.
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Cloudera DataFlow (CDF)

coveo:metadata.keywords: Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA),Modernize Architecture,Financial Services,Cloudera Altus,Webinars
coveo:metadata.description: In this webinar, we will look at how Cloudera enables financial institutions like RBS to navigate their data journey and overcome the challenges faced with data silos and consistency across on-premises, public and private cloud environments.
coveo:metadata.title: The data architecture for hybrid cloud at RBS

coveo:metadata.description: Clouderas Data Science Workbench (CDSW) is available for Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) clusters for secure, collaborative data science at scale. During this webinar, we provide an introductory tour of CDSW and a demonstration of a machine learning workflow using CDSW on HDP.
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Cloudera Data Science Workbench for HDP - EMEA

coveo:metadata.description: In this session, we will cover how to move beyond structured, curated reports based on known questions on known data, to an ad-hoc exploration of all data to optimize business processes and into the unknown questions on unknown data, where machine learning and statistically motivated predictive analytics are shaping business strategy.
coveo:metadata.title: Data Driven Enterprises Run the Cloudera Modern Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Fast Forward Labs latest research report and prototype explore learning with limited labeled data. This capability relaxes the stringent labeled data requirement in supervised machine learning and opens up new product possibilities. It is industry invariant, addresses the labeling pain point and enables applications to be built faster and more efficiently.
coveo:metadata.title: Machine Learning with Limited Labeled Data

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera DataFlow is a mature and robust toolset for handling data-in-motion and now we are announcing major additions and improvements. Introducing Cloudera Flow Management and Cloudera Edge Management - the latest additions to the Cloudera DataFlow toolset.
coveo:metadata.title: Data-in-Motion Tech Launch Showcase

coveo:metadata.description: SDI is modernizing their reporting process by leveraging Cloudera and Trifacta to automate workflows, expand reporting and grow their business beyond their expectations. As a result, SDI delivers increased pre-pricing for their customers to 20%-30%.
coveo:metadata.title: How SDI modernized supply chain data

coveo:metadata.product: Cloudera Altus|Cloudera Enterprise|Data Science and Engineering|Data Warehouse
coveo:metadata.keywords: Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA),Cloudera Altus,Cloudera Enterprise,Webinars,Data Science and Engineering,Data Warehouse
coveo:metadata.description:
Faced with challenges around everything from customer engagement to risk management, and cybersecurity to operational excellence, businesses everywhere must become data-driven if they are to remain competitive.
Bypassing many of the cost and organisational bottlenecks associated with implementing new capacity in on-premise data centres, the cloud will play a key role in this.
But becoming data-driven means servicing the requirements of all the stakeholders who work with that data. To avoid creating unsustainable data silos, enterprises require the flexibility to support each stakeholder group in an environment where data, governance and security policies are shared and enforced comprehensively and consistently.
coveo:metadata.title: Harnessing the Cloud for Big Data Insights

coveo:metadata.description:
Thriving with data science and machine learning means not only having the right platforms, tools and skills, but identifying use cases and implementing processes that can deliver repeatable, scalable business value. The challenges are numerous, from selecting data sets and data platforms, to architecting and optimizing data pipelines, and model training and deployment. In response, new solutions have emerged to deliver key capabilities in areas including visualization, self-service and real-time analytics.
Watch this webinar to hear about:
Moving from isolated pockets of success to an enterprise AI factory model where capabilities can be built and deployed consistently and repeatedly.
Scaling enterprise machine learning across multiple dimensions, from strategy and people skills, to corporate compliance and technology platforms, to drive business adoption.
Tapping technology platforms designed to unlock the power of open source for deploying machine learning capabilities with enterprise-grade security, governance and scale.
Use cases and solutions for data science and machine learning spanning multiple industries.
coveo:metadata.title: Expanding Data Science and Machine Learning Capabilities

coveo:metadata.description: Never heard of Cloudera Data Science Workbench (CDSW), or thought you knew all there is to know? The data science tools landscape can be confusing, and when it comes to empowering data scientists with the right tools, one size does not fit all. CDSW delivers self-service data science and data engineering for coding data scientists, including secure access to scale-out processing on CDH, and now, HDP clusters, and access to data stored anywhere. In this webinar well cover everything you need to know about the features and functionality of CDSW for powering enterprise data science from research to production.
coveo:metadata.title: Deep dive demo and whats new with Cloudera Data Science Workbench

coveo:metadata.description: In this Cloudera webinar featuring guest speaker Carl W. Olofson, Research Vice President, Data Management Software, IDC, learn that since the original data warehouse idea, whats changed, whats needed, and what are the business drivers for building a fully digital enterprise, including considerations for security and privacy, definitional metadata, and platform requirements.
coveo:metadata.title: Speed, Flexibility, and Intelligence: Beyond the Traditional Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: In this demo, Jeff Fletcher, Machine Learning Field Engineer at Cloudera, highlights model operations workflows using CDSW and leverages real customer examples. Once models have been developed, trained and deployed, this session dives into model operations including deploying and managing those models in production using CDSW so it can be done consistently, anywhere and efficiently.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar Series: Using Cloudera Data Science Workbench for ML from Research to Production Part 2 of 3

coveo:metadata.description: In this demo Michael Gregory, Machine Learning Field Engineer at Cloudera, draws upon his work with customers to provide a summary and overview of the development phases of the machine learning workflow in CDSW. He shows: -How CDSW enables the development of enterprise-grade ML applications -How to access data, explore data, prepare and clean the data in CDSW -How to leverage CDSW in the training and modeling phase - giving data scientists self-service access to scale out compute resources and environments they need to tune and track experiments with their models
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar Series: Using Cloudera Data Science Workbench for ML from Research to Production Part 1 of 3

coveo:metadata.description: We hope youll join us for a live webinar where we will highlight the success of customers adopting a cloud-first strategy for gaining insight across their organizational data. We will discuss frequent cloud use cases across healthcare as well as benefits for employing blockchain in the cloud.
coveo:metadata.title: Leveraging the cloud for precision medicine and more

coveo:metadata.description: In this demo session Jeff Fletcher, Machine Learning Field Engineer at Cloudera, focuses on using Cloudera Data Science Workbench for application prototyping to demonstrate how your ML models can be implemented in data products or business processes. Examples, from Cloudera customers, will also showcase building explainability into your models for transparency and prescriptive insights for your apps.
coveo:metadata.title: Webinar Series: Using Cloudera Data Science Workbench for ML from Research to Production Part 3 of 3

coveo:metadata.description:
Communication Service Providers sit on a goldmine of data, however, they have always struggled to extract meaningful value from it. So how can Telcos accelerate their data journey and drive compelling business impacts?
Tune into this webinar to learn more about how some of the leading Telecommunication providers around the globe are using analytics and machine learning as a lever to drive business outcomes.
As part of this webinar you can learn more about key data management challenges for Telcos, top use cases and a use case maturity roadmap, and real-world examples and customer case studies.
coveo:metadata.title: Data-Driven Transformation for Telcos - Use Cases & Key Examples

coveo:metadata.description:
Enterprises are struggling to see value from their IoT implementations. Some of the key challenges with IoT implementations revolve around a simple task getting real-time data from the edge devices. Challenges include network availability, latency, cost of roundtripping between the edge and the enterprise, monitoring etc. Edge Management is the ability to manage and monitor thousands of edge agents that are deployed in or near the edge devices to enable edge data collection, enhance edge processing and streamline management of data from edge to enterprise.
Watch this video to learn how your enterprise can take advantage of edge management in your IoT initiatives. Learn more about Cloudera Edge Management and how you can leverage it for addressing your own IoT challenges.
coveo:metadata.title: Edge Management: Gaining value from IoT

coveo:metadata.description: Experience a demonstration of Cloudera Data Platform (CDP), the industrys first enterprise data cloud. The new cloud service delivers powerful self-service analytics across hybrid and multi-cloud environments, along with sophisticated and granular security and governance policies that IT and data leaders demand.
coveo:metadata.title: Get an exclusive first look at Cloudera Data Platform

coveo:metadata.keywords: Insurance,Customer Experience Management,Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA),Webinars,DataFlow
coveo:metadata.description:
Discover how AXA Belgium centralized, standardized and improved their data sets in order to achieve data science compatibility, GDPR compliance, centralized data discovery and more. By implementing this solution, AXA Belgium now have the flexibility to implement future innovations, including customer 360 in real time, from 10 different sources.
Watch this video to discover more about AXA Belgiums tech stack, reasons for implementation, cross-business benefits and next steps.
coveo:metadata.title: How does AXA Belgium replicate its operational data into the data lake?

coveo:metadata.description: Please join Hilary Mason, general manager, Machine Learning, at Cloudera, together with Cloudera Machine Learning product experts for a tour of newly available products and services, including Cloudera Data Science Workbench (CDSW) 1.6, and a preview of upcoming innovations that reflect Clouderas ongoing commitment to help customers industrialize AI.
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Cloudera Data Science Workbench 1.6 and New ML Services

coveo:metadata.keywords: Retail, eCommerce & Consumer Products,Videos,Webinars,IoT Connected Products
coveo:metadata.description: With more than $15 Billion spent on Cloud computing, retailers are increasingly adopting Cloud technologies in order to drive greater agility and compete better. They are re-prioritizing investments in the cloud to handle multi-structured (big) data and real-time (IoT) feeds across the enterprise. -- Sponsored by Intel
coveo:metadata.title: Cloud Computing in Retail: The Why, How, and So What?

coveo:metadata.description: Both before and after the merger, Cloudera has many great capabilities available to assist you in getting the most from your Data Warehouse use cases. This session will demonstrate many capabilities, some only previously available to one distribution, now available to everyone.
coveo:metadata.title: Things We Bet You Didnt Know Your Cloudera Data Warehouse Can Do!

coveo:metadata.keywords: Kafka,IoT Connected Products,Cloudera Enterprise,Webinars,Cloudera Data Hub
coveo:metadata.description: Streaming architectures are on the rise and enterprises are struggling to scale up as needed. Apache Kafka has emerged as a winner for now amongst the major stream processing engines. However, Kafka can do wonders for a scalable streaming architecture provided it is set up, configured and implemented appropriately. Listen to one of the original Kafka team members and a leader in this space.
coveo:metadata.title: Kafka Power Chat: Challenges in Streaming Architectures

coveo:metadata.description: Experience the Cloudera Data Warehouse on Cloudera Data Platform (CDP), the industry's first enterprise data cloud. Learn how data-driven businesses enable thousands of new users and hundreds of new use cases with the Cloudera Data Warehouse on CDP.
coveo:metadata.title: Experience the First Hybrid Multi-Cloud Data Warehouse on CDP

coveo:metadata.description: For enterprise practitioners implementing business-specific capabilities, there is more to gain with a deeper understanding of how these technologies work and the newest, most efficient methods of application. Join the Fast Forward Labs team to hear about the latest advancements, including tips you can use to get a headstart as a hands-on applied ML practitioner.
coveo:metadata.title: Advancing ML with Deep Learning and Transfer Learning

coveo:metadata.description: According to TDWI surveys, the leading driver for modernizing a data warehouse is to enable business-focused, data-driven use cases that are new to the organization. Hence, the new use cases enabled by a modernized data warehouse can transform a business that needs to become more digital, competitive, agile, analytically driven, and modern in every way. In addition, the value of these business-focused use cases proves that there is indeed an organizational need for data warehouse modernization and a business return on the investment. Watch this TDWI webinar recording to learn about new business-driven use cases that are uniquely supported by a modern data warehouse.
coveo:metadata.title: New Data and New Use Cases Powered by the Modern Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: Join this webinar to learn how to build a scalable ML cybersecurity strategy that moves models from the lab and into production to detect risks and threats. Well cover how to address challenges related to limited or poor data, how to implement ML models to complement and scale the work your teams are doing, and use cases including edge device connectivity and more.
coveo:metadata.title: How to adopt real-time machine learning in cybersecurity

coveo:metadata.description: During this roundtable discussion, hear from industry analysts and experts, including Gigaoms Andrew Brust, about operationalizing and industrializing AI, getting ML into production, moving beyond ML and AI tools and platforms to strategy and best practices, and more.
coveo:metadata.title: Making AI Routine, Repeatable and Reliable

coveo:metadata.description: How do you find out what you didn't know you needed to know? This is the question modern data warehouses are tasked with. Because a modern data warehouse has self-service, advanced analytics, and access to tremendous volumes of data sets, we can answer this question. Using techniques for deep research and discovery, complemented by data science, engineering, and machine learning, we are discovering new patterns, new correlations, and new insights. Learn how on this Quinstreet webinar recording, presented by David Dichmann, Director of Product Marketing, Cloudera Data Warehouse.
coveo:metadata.title: How Can You Get Even More Insight from Your Data Warehouse?

coveo:metadata.description: Why is data warehouse modernization such a pressing issue today? 1) Business innovation requires bigger and better data, 2) Legacy warehouse designs need serious updating & 3) Technical users need to rethink their platform choices. In this TDWI webinar recording with a presentation from Cloudera, these drivers & use cases for the modernization of the data warehouse are explored.
coveo:metadata.title: The Modernization of the Data Warehouse: Tackling New Architectures for New Use Cases in Analysis and Operations

coveo:metadata.description: Weve heard it before. A data warehouse is a place for formally-structured, highly-curated data, accommodating recurring business analyses, whereas data lakes are places for raw data, serving analytic workloads, experimental in nature. Since both conventional and experimental analysis is important in this data-driven era, were left with separate repositories, siloed data, and bifurcated skill sets. Or are we? Learn the answer on this GigaOM webinar recording.
coveo:metadata.title: Unifying Analytics Across Warehouse, Lake and Into the Cloud

coveo:metadata.keywords: IoT Connected Products,Cloudera Enterprise,Webinars,Cloudera Data Hub
coveo:metadata.description: Join us on this webinar to listen to guest speaker Mike Gualtieri, VP, Principal Analyst, Forrester, break down the findings from the study and provide guidance on how your organization can scale up your streaming architecture. Dinesh Chandrasekhar, Head of Product Marketing, Data-in-Motion at Cloudera will also be joining this webinar to analyze the interpretations and moderate the discussion with Mike.
coveo:metadata.title: Forrester Study: Data Stream Processing & Analytics Challenges

coveo:metadata.description: Join Clouderas Chief Customer Officer Anupam Singh and Senior Director of Product Marketing Sushant Rao as they discuss how to develop an enterprise data strategy and the recent Harvard Business Review survey on Critical Success Factors for an enterprise data strategy.
coveo:metadata.title: Critical Success Factors for an Enterprise Data Strategy

coveo:metadata.description:
Tune in with technical experts to learn more about Cloudera's machine learning platform for enterprise data science teams. Each session will feature a product overview including a live demo and Q&A for both end-user, data scientists and administrators.
What you'll learn:
Connect to and explore large data sets with Apache Spark using Python and R Optimize Spark configurations for the work required Create a shareable output that can be used to explain the data analysis with tables and graphs.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Machine Learning Platform | Session 1

coveo:metadata.description: Modern data warehousing provides a wide array of analytics options on huge volumes of data. Deliver high-quality experiences to your growing number of self-service users by properly implementing fundamental building blocks.
coveo:metadata.title: How-Tos For Gurus: Building Blocks for the Modern Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: In this webinar, discover how Cloudera Machine Learning (CML), part of the new Cloudera Data Platform (CDP), brings the agility and economics of cloud to self-service data science on governed business data at scale.
coveo:metadata.title: Enable the AI-first enterprise with Cloudera Machine Learning for Cloudera Data Platform

coveo:metadata.description: Join industry thought-leaders Tony Baer, Principal at dbInsight and Cindy Maike, VP of Industry Solutions at Cloudera as they discuss considerations and practical approaches for guiding a digital transformation journey.
coveo:metadata.title: Considerations for Devising Your Enterprise Cloud Strategy

coveo:metadata.description: Hear from Anupam Singh, together with Raman Rajasekhar, as they share their experiences using Cloudera Workload XM to help customers maintain, optimize, and protect their data warehouses.
coveo:metadata.title: How Workload XM Saved My Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: This webinar is essential for stakeholders grappling with how to standardize and scale machine learning production across their business.
coveo:metadata.title: Defining and Standardizing Machine Learning Operations

coveo:metadata.description:
Were introducing Cloudera Streaming Analytics (CSA), powered by Apache Flink, as a new product offering within the Cloudera DataFlow (CDF) platform.
Cloudera Streaming Analytics (CSA) provides real-time stateful processing of IoT-scale data streams and complex events for predictive insights and is made available on our innovative Cloudera Data Platform (CDP) Data Center.
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Cloudera Streaming Analytics

coveo:metadata.description: Join Quantexa and Cloudera as they demonstrate how theyve partnered with HSBC, Standard Chartered and other leading financial organizations to leverage the power of data, dynamic entity resolution, and advanced network analytics to solve major financial crime challenges while enhancing customer intelligence and improving business outcomes.
coveo:metadata.title: Next Generation Data and Analytics to Fight Financial Crime

coveo:metadata.description: An exclusive look at the product roadmap for Cloudera Data Platform (CDP). CDP is the industrys first enterprise data cloud, delivering multi-function analytics and comprehensive security, governance, and control across hybrid and multi-cloud environments.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Data Platform roadmap update

coveo:metadata.description:
Putting machine learning into production in the enterprise is not easy; many organizations are struggling to implement the technology at scale. But it is possible to make the process of building, scaling, and deploying enterprise machine learning solutions repeatable and predictable.
Learn from Tom Davenport, Presidents Distinguished Professor of IT and Management, Babson College; Alex Breshears, Product Marketing, Cloudera; and Abbie Lundberg, Business Technology Analyst, Lundberg Media on the specific challenges enterprises face in machine learning, and how they can create an end-to-end machine learning capability.
coveo:metadata.title: MIT SMR Webinar: How to Scale Production Machine Learning in the Enterprise

coveo:metadata.description: CDP Data Center is the industrys most powerful, comprehensive data management and analytics platform for on-premises IT environments. Powered by a 100% open source distribution that combines the best technologies from Cloudera and Hortonworks, CDP provides the foundation for extending your workloads to private cloud.
coveo:metadata.title: Accelerate your time-to-insight with CDP Data Center

coveo:metadata.description: Join guest speaker, Forrester Principal Analyst Noel Yuhanna, and Cloudera Senior Product Marketing Manager Wim Stoop, as they discuss: Trends in enterprise hybrid and multi-cloud. New and emerging value-creating use cases it enables. How enterprise data cloud fabrics evolve and accelerate success.
coveo:metadata.title: Powering the digital enterprise with hybrid and multi-cloud

coveo:metadata.description: We all know our future for data warehousing is in the cloud. As we start making our way there, we recognize a number of challenges - there is no one cloud that can solve all our needs today, and there is no single step to move everything we have on-premises into the cloud. This DBTA webinar recording explores the hybrid and multi-cloud as it relates to data warehousing and what you can do today with a modern data warehouse to embrace these concepts and succeed.
coveo:metadata.title: The Long Tail of the Hybrid and Multi-Cloud

coveo:metadata.description: We are getting close to the launch of Cloudera Data Platform, the industrys first enterprise data cloud. Find out what to expect from our new public cloud service and when CDP will be available on-premises. We will also cover recent updates and upcoming enhancements to our Enterprise Data Hub and HDP platforms.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Data Platform Roadmap Update

coveo:metadata.description: From fraud and security threat detection to flagging abnormalities in healthcare imaging data, there are countless business applications for automatic identification of abnormal data. This process can be challenging, especially when working with large, complex data. This talk explores deep learning approaches (Sequence models, VAEs, GANs) for anomaly detection, when to use them, performance benchmarks and product possibilities.
coveo:metadata.title: Deep Learning for Anomaly Detection

coveo:metadata.description: The explosive growth in Time Series Data is being driven by advances in sensors, connections, databases, online systems, and analytics tools. Time Series analytics provides business insights that enable firms to forecast and predict the future. Extracting high-quality insight from Time Series data can be challenging because it is multi-dimensional, complex, huge in scale, and often driven by the Internet of Things (IoT). To leverage this asset, it is important to develop infrastructure with not only enormous storage and computing power, but also sophisticated analytics capabilities. Outlook Series' Michael Lippis interviews Eva Nahari to gain Cloudera's perspective on Time Series Analytics.
coveo:metadata.title: Podcast: Time Series Analytics Drives More Granular Visibility of Trends in Data

coveo:metadata.description: Many organizations face a two-fold challenge with changing business requirements and massively growing datasets. Before selecting a modern data warehouse solution, organizations should first understand the use cases, potential pitfalls, and what to look for in evaluating the best modern data warehouse solution to meet their specific needs. Watch this Actual Tech webinar recording to learn the top five criteria for evaluating a modern data warehouse.
coveo:metadata.title: Top Five Criteria For Evaluating a Modern Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: Todays data warehouse looks radically different from where it began over 30 years ago. It now delivers more data-driven decisions and predictions than ever before. New technologies, new techniques, new science, and new business theories drive innovation in the ever-evolving discipline of data warehousing and analytics.
coveo:metadata.title: Modern Data Warehouse Fundamentals

coveo:metadata.description: Join Informatica and Cloudera to learn more about how some of the leading enterprises around the globe are generating valuable customer insights to drive business growth.
coveo:metadata.title: Building a 360 view of the customer with a modern data platform

coveo:metadata.description: The ability to effectively use and analyze data is fast becoming the difference between success and failure. And many organizations will build analytics and intelligence systems utilizing their data warehouse as the foundation. However, many existing data warehouses were designed and deployed prior to this need. This IDG webinar recording will examine the drivers for modernization; look at how organizations can enhance current data warehouses; and discuss the need to develop a modern data warehouse strategy to support the next-generation analytics and business intelligence.
coveo:metadata.title: Enhancing Your Data Warehouse to Meet the Demands of Advanced Analytics and BI

coveo:metadata.description:
A recent TDWI survey reveals two trends: 1) roughly a quarter of organizations polled have a data warehouse deployed exclusively on cloud. Another quarter has a hybrid data warehouse that distributes data across data platforms on-premises and cloud & 2) organizations of many sizes and industries continue to modernize their data warehouses, so they can keep pace with evolving data and growing data-driven practices in analytics and self-service.
These two trends intersect, such that data warehouse modernization and cloud adoption often go hand in hand. This is largely because both seek to assure extreme scalability, lower administrative and platform costs, and support new business analytics. In this TDWI webinar recording, both practices are discussed with a focus on coordinating the two.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloud at Scale for Modern Data Warehousing

coveo:metadata.description: This webinar is the first in a recurring quarterly webinar to engage with you, our valued customers to foster deeper partnerships, share customer use cases, offer a preview of product roadmaps, collaborate with you on how to solve your most pressing challenges, and help lay the groundwork for developing a Cloudera user-led customer community in the future.

coveo:metadata.description: With the growth of Apache Kafkas adoption in all major streaming initiatives across large organizations, the operational and visibility challenges associated with Kafka are on the rise as well. Kafka users want better visibility in understanding what is going on in the clusters as well as within the stream flows across producers, topics, brokers, and consumers. With no tools in the market that readily address the challenges of the Kafka Ops teams, the development teams and the security/governance teams, Cloudera Streams Messaging Manager (SMM) comes in as a total game-changer to cure Kafka blindness.
coveo:metadata.title: Kafka Power Chat: Curing Kafka Blindness

coveo:metadata.description: Today, modern data warehousing has evolved to meet the intensive demands the newest analytics require to be data-driven. Outlook Series' Michael Lippis interviews David Dichmann and Raman Rajasekhar to gain their perspectives on data warehouse optimization.

coveo:metadata.description: Time series analytics provides game-changing insights for your business, allowing you to forecast and predict the future. They discuss the best practices that enterprises are using to successfully develop and operationalize ML and AI solutions that drive transformational outcomes.

coveo:metadata.description: Given the explosion, speed, and performance of data stored and processed, queries heavily depend on how the data is modeled. coveo:metadata.title: Looking Before You Leap Into the Cloud

coveo:metadata.description:
Just as in the 1990s businesspeople the world over tried to work out what the rise of the internet would do to their companies, they are now trying to determine what artificial intelligence (AI) will mean for them. AI has already changed the technology sector, helping to consolidate the reign of firms like Google, Facebook, and Amazon, which embraced AI early so as to supercharge they're advertising and retail businesses. Now AI is set to spread beyond the Silicon Valley giants to many other industries, including agriculture, energy, finance, healthcare, retail, manufacturing and more.
How should these firms go about determining their AI strategy, and what will it mean for the future of their business? This special report will argue that by enabling them to become more efficient and make far more accurate forecasts, AI will dramatically and fundamentally change the way they work. The report will analyze the effect of different kinds of artificial intelligence (such as computer vision and speech recognition), as well as applications such as human resources, where it will change the way companies recruit, hire and retain staff. Big firms like Johnson & Johnson, which makes medical devices, and Unilever, a consumer-products company, are already experimenting with it. AI will also make a big difference to business functions such as customer service, sales, and supply-chain management.
In addition, the report will look at the ecosystems that provide AI to companies, including consulting and cloud services and ask which firms will benefit from this technology. And it will consider the future of the workplace at a time when companies are able to collect more data than ever to serve as a basis for decision-making.
Lastly, it will examine what AI might to do competition among firms, and whether companies will be better off embracing AI to gain an advantage over rivals, or whether they would be wiser to hold back and learn from the mistakes of others. AI has already caused considerable upheaval in the tech industry and created winners and losers there. It is bound to prove equally disruptive in other sectors.
coveo:metadata.title: The Economist Special Report: AI and Business

coveo:metadata.description: Machine learning and artificial intelligence are changing the very meaning of data analytics. Some say the rise of AI and machine learning heralds a new industrial revolution. This Database Trends and Applications article explains the imminent convergence of machine learning and IoT.

coveo:metadata.keywords: Data warehouse replacement,Analyst Reports,Cloudera Altus,Analytics,Analyst Reports,Cloud,Data Warehouse,Data warehousing offload,Modernize Architecture
coveo:metadata.description: Data warehousing is alive, but perhaps not alive and well. Legacy data warehouses must modernize to fit gracefully into modern analytics ecosystems. They play an important role in data management as an archive of enterprise history and a source of carefully curated and highly integrated data for a broad scope of line-of-business information needs. To continue filling that role well, they must evolve both architecturally and technologically. Yet in many instances, data warehouse evolution is stalled due to uncertainty about what, how, and when to change. This report provides guidance to break the logjam and begin moving to data warehouses that are agile, scalable, and adaptable in the face of continuous change. It describes how patterns of architectural restructuring, cloud migration, virtualization, and more can be used to combine data warehouses with big data, cloud, NoSQL and other recent technologies to resolve many of todays data warehousing challenges and to prepare for the future of data warehousing.
coveo:metadata.title: Future

coveo:metadata.description: As enterprise data warehouses evolve to become modern data warehouses in the cloud, they still hold a significant role for enterprise analytics as a vital component of an enterprise data analytics platform. The reality is that this evolution will be a hybrid-cloud architecture that requires shared and unified capabilities to represent both cloud and on-premises environments as a single data analytics platform for the business. A multi-cloud architecture will be likely for many companies as data gravity from more data sources, users, and applications shifts data processing among clouds, requiring open data architecture principles and furthering the need for enterprise data unification and governance.

coveo:metadata.description:
Data has a shelf life. In todays streaming architectures, data can become worthless unless enterprises can harvest it in real time and act on it within that limited window of opportunity.
However, most enterprises are unable to prepare and analyze data in a timely manner to enable business decision making. They face key data management challenges, including data readiness, skill shortages, and infrastructure shortcomings, such as not having the correct stream processing engine for the job.
This commissioned study conducted by Forrester Consulting, on behalf of Cloudera1, surveyed more than 150 data professionals in multiple industries and different roles to understand how organizations are currently addressing these challenges.
coveo:metadata.title: The Speed Of Digital Business Demands Streaming Analytics Platforms - Now

coveo:metadata.description: The pressure to leverage data as a business asset is stronger than ever. Enterprises everywhere are eager to devise sound data strategies that are realistic and achievable, based on available budget and sensitive to in-house technology skill sets. Recent advances in storage costs and compute scalability issues, especially in the cloud, have addressed the most important challenges previously faced by Data Warehouse platforms. We are in a Data Warehouse (DW) renaissance period. Problems with Data Warehouses have largely been solved, petabyte-scale data volumes no longer defeat them and the familiarity and ease of use that kept them viable all this time are now helping them face their open source big data competition and, in many cases, emerge victorious. In this Giga OM report, discover todays Data Warehouse landscape in the context of where the technology has been, where it is, and where it is going.
coveo:metadata.title: Revenge of the Data Warehouse

For whole genome, only Hadoop delivers the best architecture for the most relevant work and the greatest option value at lowest cost.

coveo:metadata.keywords: Solution Briefs,Enterprise Data Hub (EDH),Documents,Cloudera Enterprise,Hadoop,Big Data,Energy & Utilities,Solution Briefs
coveo:metadata.description: As a highly regulated service provider, the utilitys primary obligation is uninterrupted provision of services without price increases due to unforeseen demand. With an enterprise data hub, service providers are able to converge complete streaming data from multiple sources in full fidelity. Where purpose-built systems historically lagged notifications provided by customer complaints, analytics and visualization based on Hadoop tools provide a real-time view of outages and their causes so that the utility can fully comprehend the extent of a reliability issue and respond accordingly, often even before the impact can be observed by consumers. In addition to reliability and consistency in the delivery of services, utilities are shifting their focus to optimizing voltage in anticipation of demand. Service providers are using big data to prioritize control of both capital expenditure and existing resource management, as well as to prevent spiky increases in customer pricing.
coveo:metadata.title: Utilities and the Big Data Opportunity of an Enterprise Data Hub

coveo:metadata.description: As the data volumes continue to grow at an exponential rate, Communication Service Providers (CSPs) are faced with some critical data management challenges including - multiple business and operational data silos, new and diverse data sources and increasing cost of data storage and processing. More and more CSPs are turning to Hadoop as a means to store, analyze and gain insights from virtually unlimited amounts of data in a cost-effective manner. With an enterprise data hub from Cloudera, powered by Apache Hadoop, Telcos can easily bring together data from multiple sources (both structured and unstructured) into a single, unified platform in order to gain a true 360-degree view of their customers, drive down churn, optimize network performance and launch new revenue streams.
coveo:metadata.title: Driving Value for Telcos with an Enterprise Data Hub

coveo:metadata.description: PCI-DSS originated as separate data security standards established by the five major credit card companies: Visa, MasterCard, Discover, American Express, and the Japan Credit Bureau. The goal was to ensure that cardholder data is properly secured and protected and that merchants meet minimum-security levels when storing, processing, and transmitting this data. In 2004, the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council was formed to align the individual policies from each credit card company into an industry-wide standard.
coveo:metadata.title: PCI Compliance Solution Brief

coveo:metadata.description: The HIPAA and HITECH regulations were put in place to protect personal health record information from fraud and abuse. Over the past several years, more than 20 million patients have had their medical information exposed in data security breaches, even with HIPAA and HITECH regulations already being in place. This paper will document how Cloudera Navigator Encrypt and Navigator Trustee can help organizations that store HIPAA data maintain a secure and compliant posture through robust encryption and key management.
coveo:metadata.title: HIPAA and HITECH Regulations

coveo:metadata.description: In the time it takes to read this brief article, Dell SecureWorks will have collected and analyzed information on millions of IT events that took place during the same interval at thousands of customer sites around the world. This is all part of the work of an information security services organization that never sleeps. Dell SecureWorks is on deck 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, to help protect the security of its customers assets in real time. To meet its enormous data processing challenges, Dell SecureWorks requires leading-edge technologies for cost-effectively storing, scaling, and analyzing massive amounts of information in real time. And thats just what it found in the Dell | Cloudera Solution for high-speed data analysis, mining, and processing.
coveo:metadata.title: Dell SecureWorks slashes the cost of storage with Dell | Cloudera Hadoop solution

coveo:metadata.description: Rapleaf processes the many feeds of data that it collects and synthesizes all of that data into a single, accurate view using Hadoop. Log messages are sent through Scribe and loaded into the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). Log data is loaded into Hadoop every ten minutes, amounting to 1-2 TB each day. Other data sources load hourly or daily. Rapleaf has other jobs that run periodically on the logs to compute stats and make sure everything is running correctly.
coveo:metadata.title: Rapleaf Works Smarter with Cloudera

coveo:metadata.description: MicroStrategys business intelligence platform delivers actionable information to business users via e-mail, web, and mobile devices, including the iPhone, iPad, and BlackBerry. Companies choose MicroStrategy for its ease-of-use, sophisticated analytics, and superior data and user scalability. MicroStrategy enables you to: Perform point-and-click analytics on data stored in Apache Hadoop Query large quantities of structured and unstructured data using tools that are familiar to your organization Easily integrate Apache Hadoop into your data analytics environment
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera And MicroStrategy Deliver Easy-to-Use Business Intelligence for Apache Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Patterns and Predictions (P&P) is a predictive analytics firm with a core technology that provides unstructured and linguistics driven prediction. It is the technology powering the Durkheim Projects Big Data analytics network for the assessment of mental health risks -- veteran suicide risk in particular. The technical rubric for the project is maximum speed at minimum cost." "With Cloudera Search and Impala, our ingestion of data on Hadoop is promisingly efficient in terms of lower costs, better computational throughput, and reduced complexity of IT support. The Durkheim Project is named in honor of David Emile Durkheim, a French sociologist whose 1897 publication, Suicide, defined early text analysis for suicide risk and provided important theoretical explanations relating to societal disconnection. The project follows its namesakes lead in its search for what Durkheim referred to as the qualities of suicide those specific patterns and clues that point to suicide risk. The Durkheim Project, though, has one valuable tool at its disposal that the founding sociologist didnt have: technology.
coveo:metadata.title: Patterns and Predictions Uses Big Data to Predict Veteran Suicide Risk

coveo:metadata.description: The Revolution Analytics and Cloudera partnership combines the power of R and Apache Hadoop for organizations ready to break the status quo and shatter the performance, scalability, and deployment limits that have encumbered their ability to use Hadoop for advanced predictive analytics projects. Now they can apply turbo-charged R to all the data in Hadoop to discover deeper insights, grow more quickly, and operate more efficiently. Ask bigger questions. Ask new questions. Get better, faster results and share them.
coveo:metadata.title: Revolution Analytics Solution Overview

coveo:metadata.description:
The use of GPS-connected telematics devices in vehicles has driven a dramatic increase in the number of insurers offering, and customers adopting, usage-based insurance (UBI) over the last five years. The Bank of Englands mission is to promote the good of UK citizens by maintaining monetary and financial stability. As well as managing the UKs currency, supply of money and interest rates, the institute has a diverse range of responsibilities including gathering and analyzing data from banks, building societies, credit unions, insurers and mortgage companies to inform policy decisions and guide UK government departments and international organizations.
coveo:metadata.title: Bank Of England: using data analytics to build a stable future

coveo:metadata.product: Cloudera Enterprise|Operational DB|Cloudera Altus|Data Science and Engineering
coveo:metadata.keywords: Transportation,Cloudera Enterprise,Operational DB,Cloudera Altus,Success Stories,Data Science and Engineering,Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA),Industrial IoT
coveo:metadata.description: Lufthansa Technik helps airlines predict and prevent maintenance issues that can delay flights and increase costs with an IoT analytics platform powered by Cloudera on Azure.
coveo:metadata.title: Lufthansa Technik: Reducing airline operating cost by leveraging Clouderas big data and analytics on AVITAR for preventive and predictive maintenance

coveo:metadata.description: Johns Hopkins University is an American private research university founded in 1876 and located in Baltimore, Maryland. It is considered the first research university in the United States, with campuses in Maryland and Washington, D.C. Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL), is the nations largest university-affiliated research center. The non-profit organization applies its research to areas such as air and missile defense, space science, and medicine, among others.
coveo:metadata.title: Johns Hopkins: enabling precision medicine and improved patient care

coveo:metadata.description: Scania is a world leading provider of transport solutions and is leading the shift towards sustainable transport systems. In 2018 it delivered 88,000 trucks, 8,500 buses as well as 12,800 industrial and marine engines to customers. Research and development is in Sweden, with branches in Brazil and India. Production takes place in Europe, Latin America and Asia, with regional production centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia.
coveo:metadata.title: Scania: Driving Logistical Efficiency and Sustainability with Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: Searcher Seismic is an independent multi-client company, headquartered in Western Australia, that provides high quality, non-exclusive subsurface datasets to the global Oil & Gas industry. Searchers leading edge data sets are used by their customers to de-risk their exploration portfolios in a cost-effective manner.
coveo:metadata.title: Utilizing Seismic Data Provides a Map to De-risk Exploration

coveo:metadata.description: Informatica is the worlds leader in Enterprise Cloud Data Management. The company provides customers the foresight to become more agile, realize new growth opportunities, and create new inventions. In early 2019, Informatica acquired AllSight, next-generation Customer Data Platform provider, which helps enterprises use data to improve customer experiences through AI-enabled software focused on managing and improving customer intelligence.
coveo:metadata.title: Building a 360 customer view with a modern data platform

coveo:metadata.description: PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk (BRI) is one of the largest and oldest banks in Indonesia and engages in the provision of general banking services. Headquartered in Jakarta, Indonesia, BRI is well-known for its focus on microfinancing initiatives, and serves over 75 million customers through its above 11,000 offices, units, and rural service posts.
coveo:metadata.title: Bank BRI: Utilizing Big Data, AI and ML to better understand customers

coveo:metadata.description: One of the nation's elite research universities, Florida State University (FSU) preserves, expands, and disseminates knowledge in the sciences, technology, arts, humanities, and professions, while embracing a philosophy of learning strongly rooted in the traditions of the liberal arts and critical thinking. Founded in 1851, it is located on the oldest continuous site of higher education in the state of Florida.
coveo:metadata.title: Florida State University Boosts Student Success through Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: The U.S. Census Bureau built an Enterprise Data Lake to bring together and efficiently analyze petabytes of data collected from the 2020 census. The EDL helps the agency keep data private and secure and uncover important insights that drive resource allocation across government.
coveo:metadata.title: U.S. Census Bureau: Embracing the Digital Age With Enterprise Data Lake

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Enterprise extensively explained and demonstrated in this screencast video by Charles Zedlewski, VP Product at Cloudera. Cloudera Enterprise Objectives: Improve the effectiveness of Apache Hadoop in production, fit Hadoop into existing policies and processes, and make Hadoop cost effective in production.

Here Philip Langdale, Philip Zeyliger, and Charles Zedlewski talk you through a cluster installation.
coveo:metadata.title: SCM Express Tutorial Screencast (Director's Cut)

coveo:metadata.description: Using MicroStrategy we import data, perform joins of data sets, and build a query without coding. Then we build a visual dashboard that best represents the results of our query.
coveo:metadata.title: MicroStrategy on Hadoop using Cloudera Impala Demo

coveo:metadata.description: In version 2.4 of Hue, the open source Web UI that makes Apache Hadoop easier to use, a new app was added in addition to more than 150 fixes: Search! Using this app, which is based on Apache Solr, you can now search across Hadoop data just like you would do keyword searches with Google or Yahoo! In addition, a wizard lets you tweak the result snippets and tailors the search experience to your needs. The new Hue Search app uses the regular Solr API underneath the hood, yet adds a remarkable list of UI features that makes using search over data stored in Hadoop a breeze. It integrates with the other Hue apps like File Browser for looking at the index file in a few clicks. Heres a video demoing queries and results customization. The demo is based on Twitter Streaming data collected with Apache Flume and indexed in real time
coveo:metadata.title: Demo | The Search Application in Hue 2.4

coveo:metadata.description: See a demonstration of how data analysis is done using Hue's Beeswax application.
coveo:metadata.title: Demo | Getting Started with Data Analysis in Hue

coveo:metadata.description: Learn how to use the new Apache Pig editor introduced in Hue 2.3.
coveo:metadata.title: Demo | Hue's Pig Editor in Action

coveo:metadata.description: Apache HCatalog is a project enabling non Hive scripts to access Hive tables. Users can then directly load tables with Pig or MapReduce without having to worry about re-defining the input schemas, caring about the data location or duplicating it. HCatalog is useful for accessing Hive data from Pig. Here is a tutorial about accessing the Hive example tables through HCatLoader from the Pig Editor in Hue (gethue.com), the Apache Hadoop UI.
coveo:metadata.title: Demo | How to Use HCatalog in Hue

coveo:metadata.description: Learn what's new in HUE 2.5 and all the cool new features. Filtering, scrolling, and more.
coveo:metadata.title: Demo | What's New in HUE 2.5

coveo:metadata.description: This is an excerpt from the Tableau and Cloudera webinar on May 1st. Tableau joins us to share and demo how to apply governance to the discovery layer in an enterprise data hub while still meeting the speed and agility requirements of the business user.
coveo:metadata.title: Tableau and Cloudera Demo

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Navigator is the first fully integrated data management application for Apache Hadoop-based systems. It's designed to provide all of the capabilities required for administrators, data managers and analysts to secure, govern and explore the large amounts of diverse data that land in Hadoop.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Navigator Demo

coveo:metadata.description: The combination of SAS analytics and Clouderas enterprise data hub (EDH) is a common recipe for Analytics at Scale. While Clouderas EDH makes it not only feasible but economically viable to store and manage extreme volumes of data in one place, SAS In-Memory Analytics gives you the power to analyze and mine data at Scale all on a single system. With SAS In-Memory Statistics for Hadoop and supporting products, business users can use their existing SAS skills to analyze and mine vast volumes of data on the EDH.
coveo:metadata.title: SAS and Cloudera Demo

coveo:metadata.description: With Pentaho Instaview for Cloudera Impala, you can quickly analyze large volumes of disparate data faster than was previously possible.

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Altus is a managed service that makes it easier than ever to execute data pipelines. Launch your cluster in minutes on AWS, and start exploring and extracting value from all your data. Over time Cloudera plans to expand Altus to support other leading public clouds such as Microsoft Azure, etc.
coveo:metadata.title: Altus Demo

coveo:metadata.description: With Talend and Cloudera Altus, you can design a data integration pipeline that seamlessly spins up a transient Hadoop and Spark cluster. No need to worry about DevOps or provisioning, the entire server management is done by Cloudera Altus.
coveo:metadata.title: Altus Talend Demo

coveo:metadata.description: Machine learning is all about the data, but it's often out of reach for analytics teams working at scale. Cloudera Data Science Workbench enables fast, easy, and secure self-service data science for the enterprise.
coveo:metadata.title: Demo: Cloudera Data Science Workbench

coveo:metadata.description: Workload Experience Manager (XM) gives you the visibility necessary to efficiently migrate, analyze, optimize, and scale workloads running in a modern data warehouse. coveo:metadata.title: Demo: Cloudera Data Hub

coveo:metadata.description: With the all-new Cloudera Data Platform, IT can now say Yes to any analytic function on any cloud. IT can embrace hybrid data architectures and set up cloud data lakes with enterprise-grade security and governance in hours instead of weeks. Business users get cloud-native, easy-to-use multi-function analytics satisfying their demands for speed. CDP is a new hybrid, multi cloud approach to enterprise data management and analytics the industrys first enterprise data cloud.

coveo:metadata.description: In this demo, discover how Cloudera Data Science Workbench lets data scientists manage their own analytics pipelines, including built-in scheduling, monitoring, and email alerting. Quickly develop and prototype new machine learning projects and easily deploy them to production. This demo shows how data science teams can collaborate on one project using the 3rd party editor of their choice.
coveo:metadata.title: Demo: Cloudera Data Science Workbench

coveo:metadata.description: In his keynote at Strata 2019 in New York City, Arun Murthy, Cloudera's Chief Product Officer, introduces Cloudera Data Platform (CDP), the worlds first enterprise data cloud. CDP manages data in any environment, including multiple public clouds, bare metal, private cloud, and hybrid cloud. And with Cloudera's Shared Data Experience (SDX), the security and governance capabilities in CDP, IT can confidently deliver secure analytics running against data anywhere. CDP is a new approach to enterprise data, anywhere from the Edge to AI.
coveo:metadata.title: See the industrys first enterprise data cloud with Arun Murthy

coveo:metadata.description:
Cloudera Data Warehouse is a cloud service for creating self-service data warehouses and the underlying compute clusters for teams of business analysts.

Data Warehouse is an auto-scaling, highly concurrent and cost effective analytics service that ingests high scale data anywhere, from structured, unstructured and edge sources. It supports hybrid and multi-cloud infrastructure models by seamlessly moving workloads between on-premise and any cloud for reports, dashboards, ad-hoc and advanced analytics, including AI, with consistent security and governance. Cloudera Data Warehouse offers zero query wait times, reduced IT costs and agile delivery.

Go here to learn more about Cloudera Data Warehouse: cloudera.com/products/data-warehouse.html
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Data Platform - Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: In this demo, discover how Cloudera Machine Learning (CML), part of the new Cloudera Data Platform (CDP), allows administrators to rapidly onboard new data science teams without interrupting business workloads, giving data science teams on-demand access to business data, open tools and computing resources for end-to-end ML without waiting.
coveo:metadata.title: Demo: Cloudera Machine Learning

coveo:metadata.description: Data Hub is just one of the many experiences you can use on the Cloudera Data Platform (CDP). With Data Hub you can quickly create clusters to handle various workloads
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Data Platform - Data Hub

coveo:metadata.description:
Cloudera Machine Learning is a cloud service for creating self-service machine learning workspaces and the underlying compute clusters for teams of data scientists.

Enterprise data science teams need access to business data and the tools and computing resources required for end-to-end machine learning workflows, while IT and the business need to maintain data governance and control infrastructure costs. Cloudera Machine Learning brings the agility and economics of cloud to self-service machine learning workflows with governed business data and tools that data science teams need, anywhere.

Go here to learn more about Cloudera Machine Learning: cloudera.com/products/machine-learning.html
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Data Platform - Machine Learning

coveo:metadata.description:
Apache NiFi is an integrated data logistics and simple event processing platform. It provides an end-to-end platform that can collect, curate, analyze and act on data in real-time, on-premise, or in the cloud with a drag-and-drop visual interface.
This book is a must read. You will learn about NiFi fundamentals, NiFi use cases and how to get started, debug and manage your own dataflows.
coveo:metadata.title: Apache NiFi For Dummies, Cloudera and Attunity Special Edition

Countless enterprises around the world have already migrated workloads to the cloud to take advantage of the cost savings, scalability, and new features that on-premises environments cant deliver. coveo:metadata.description: Financial services institutions lost over $1.45 trillion in combined revenue to financial crimes in 2018, and this is increasing ever rapidly. Todays leading financial institutions are increasingly relying on data, analytics, machine learning, and AI technologies to capitalize on the information needed to combat financial crimeconverting raw data into actionable insights. Here are the top five approaches that have the greatest impact when creating next-generation approaches to fighting financial crime.

Todays leading communication service providers rely on data, analytics, machine learning, and AI technologies to capitalize on the data to drive digital transformation--converting raw data into actionable insights. Here are the top five use case domains that have the greatest impact for CSPs.

The most innovative manufacturing companies are applying industrial IoT concepts, coupled with data and analytics, to transform their product development, supply chains, and manufacturing operations. Here are the top five areas where manufacturers are using the power of analytics and machine learning to drive business success.

coveo:metadata.description: The growth of IoT adoption has been exponential across all industries, but organizations within each industry face a unique set of challenges along this journey. Enterprises leveraging all the big data generated from IoT devices in their machine learning models are able to use prescriptive and predictive analytics to make well-informed decisions. Read this ebook to learn about the challenges of implementing data-driven IoT, and solutions for addressing the challenges across multiple industries.

This infographic, based on a commissioned study conducted by Forrester Consulting on behalf of Cloudera, shows survey data from more than 150 data professionals in multiple industries and different roles to understand how organizations are currently addressing these challenges.

View the infographic, then read the full report now and apply the learnings to exact true real-time insights from your own data.
